dialogues.text: EVANS jumps on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) Center. This is SouthJet 227, We need to divert 30 degrees right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) ...for weather. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, this is Jacksonville Center. 30 Degrees, right, approved. Report back on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report back on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP banks the plane to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- the plane falls 200 feet in 2 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge air pocket pulls the rug out from under the JR-88. From the cockpit we can hear the passengers scream. EVANS holds on to his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't help you now, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP remains cool as he rides more bad air. The plane now bounces rapidly over a non-stop succession of speed bumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers clutch each other as they rattle like bobb head dolls; it's getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pushes the throttle and the 17-year-old Jackson- Ridgefield JR-88 accelerates directly into a huge black cloud. He begins to dip the nose level to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you leveling off, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to spend less time in this shitty air, Kenny. Is that alright with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pushes the 17-year-old Jackson-Ridgefield JR-88 dire into a huge black cloud. He begins to dip the nose toward the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're approaching maximum airspeed! 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking right! I'm gonna need some speed to punch through this crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers howl in fear as the plane pitches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS calls out to WHIP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over-speeding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIRSPEED INDICATOR moves from GREEN right up to the YELLOW line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP banks the plane steeply to the right. From the cabin HEAR the passengers SCREAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ATC comes on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, SouthJet 227, this is Jacksonville Center. Say altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell `em we're climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared and lying badly) Center...uh...SouthJet 227 is leaving niner thousand...for Flight Level 180.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, this is Center. You need to check your Mode-C. Your transponder indicates you're descending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS looks at WHIP -- panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're useless Evans, shit! (keys the radio) 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center. This is SouthJet 227, we've encountered some bad air here. Some pretty severe downdrafts. We're in our climb now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaking gets incredibly violent. WE HEAR SCREAMS from the cabin. Evans points to Whip's airspeed indicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your airspeed! You're too fast for this rough air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right on the line Kenny. Right on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP starts to hum the Joe Cocker song again as he cranes head up close to the windscreen -- looking intently at th dark sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon sweetheart, show me the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, we see a beam of light breaking through the bla clouds -- 12 o'clock high. A God ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP (cont'd) (CONT'D) Finally, daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP banks the plane hard, lifting the nose -- pointing i directly at the crack in the darkness. He shoves the throttles to full power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is banking, rising and accelerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screaming passengers go quiet with the strange new development. The shaking has eased from a 10 to a 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip keeps the plane climbing steeply. The Vertical Speed Indicator shows we're ascending 2,000 feet per minute. Th altimeter spins up past 12,000 ft. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murky grey outside becomes lighter and brighter, unti suddenly, in a dramatic reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly the air becomes perfectly smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip levels off and maneuvers between the two towering cl walls -- smooth as silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gliding over the fluffy white clouds and through the shimmering rays of the sun -- it feels like WHIP just fle the JR-88 into heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A joyous CHEER ERUPTS from the passenger cabin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls the power back and switches on the auto-pilot. EVANS is cheery, almost giddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad that's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP, however, is very shaky and beaded with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tall are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 thousand. That was incredible sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, turn us north and take us home. Your plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS looks at him and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up the phone) Margaret, I'm coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP hangs up, puts on his pilot hat and exits the cockpi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE has her keys out as she hustles for her door. She looks to find the door slightly open. She pushes it fully open to see FRAN, the building manager, standing in her living room holding her camera. He tries to be casual... 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is scared and pissed by his invasion of her space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fran...get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like a little ghost. I never know when you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out Fran!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the full-bodied 35 MM camera from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the building manager I have a legal right to enter an apartment if I believe the occupant is unwell. Especially if said occupant is not current on her rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a slimy step towards her. She steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran, please just gimme a minute. Get out. I have the rent. I will bring it down to you. Just let me shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could just bring the check down now, use my shower. I got good water pressure. You know that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN leans against the door frame, trying to strike a seductive pose. NICOLE smiles and holds up her camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the perfect light Fran. (he smiles, preening) Back up a little...little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN steps outside and on to the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE kicks the door shut and locks it, escaping FRAN wh calls through the door. 22.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Tricky tricky, girl. Alright, so you shower up and come down. For real. We don't gotta talk about the check. Hang out a lil bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE puts her camera down gently on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your fucking dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She now flings her purse on the ground in frustration...t contents spill on to the carpet. Amidst the flotsam we fo on yet another candy tin that springs open. NICOLE fixes stare at the hypodermic needle resting inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP exits the lavatory drying his hands with a towel. He looks down the aisle to see TRINA far down the cabin. TRI sees WHIP, comes back up the aisle and stands with her ba to him watching the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP opens a bottle of orange juice and takes a big swig. then pours half of it in the sink. WHIP places the open juice bottle on the liquor cart, reaches up, and grabs th cabin mic to address the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, this is Captain Whitaker. If you look up, I'm here in the galley. I will wave to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP steps into the aisle so the passengers can see him. WHIP waves with a calm smile that would put anyone at eas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Morning. I apologize for the bumps, but Florida just doesn't seem to like us Georgians. Must be the beatin' the Bulldogs put on the Gators last fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titters of laughter from the passengers as WHIP moves the half step he needs to put himself behind the liquor cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretch out and relax. The air might stay a little cranky so I'm gonna ask that you sit tight if you can, with your seat belts fastened. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now watch from behind WHIP as his free hand reaches in the top drawer of the liquor cart and pulls three small v bottles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't have beverage service but the girls will walk through with water and snacks and I'll have you in Atlanta in about 40 minutes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP puts the mic to its hook. Alone in the galley and ou of view, he quickly empties the vodkas into the orange ju bottle and replaces the cap. Whip shakes the juice as he tosses the little empties into the galley trash. Whip tak a healthy pull from the spiked juice, downing nearly half

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP knocks on the cockpit door. MARGARET emerges and WHI disappears in to the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framed photos on a bureau show: Christmas around the tree with Mom (30) and Dad (33) and a girl who's 8 and a boy w 5. (In the reflection of this photo we see a flame cookin heroin in a spoon.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another photo depicts an 8 year-old girl's birthday party (In the reflection of this photo see wee Nicole tying off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A last photo shows NICOLE (30)and her mom (54). They are both wearing kerchiefs. We can see that her mom is gaunt has no hair under her kerchief. (In the reflection of thi photo we see the needle injected into her arm.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HYPODERMIC NEEDLE is placed in front of that picture. N to the photos is a small CD station that NICOLE taps to l and turns up. The opening bars of Michael Fitzpatrick's "Medication" begin to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull wide to see NICOLE pull the bra from her arm that used to tie off with. Her face is pure happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes and a peach crate filled with camera equipment jo suitcase on its side that acts as a coffee table. NICOLE picks up her camera and admires it before putting it down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the cigarette she had staged pre dope fix an reaches for the lighter. She laughs and hums, pulls out g a brush...She's holding the brush when the first heavy wa of narcotic death washes over her. She leans back and use the wall for support. "Medication" is hitting its chorus. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her arms out at her sides, euphoria. A slow, slo smile breaks across her face. She exhales slowly. She reaches for the now burning cigarette when the second wav heavy drugs hits. NICOLE looks up with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE (cont'd) (CONT'D) Oh no, oh no, oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the little bag of coke that KIP gave her. Next she grabs her phone, flipping it open. As she tries dial it, she crumbles to her knees. NICOLE somewhat contr her fall to the ground, but her eyes are fading. The litt bag of coke falls from her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way to stem the tide of the oncoming overdose. NICOLE's arms stretch out in a frozen reach as her body s to the floor. On her back like a girl making angels in th snow as her eyelids flutter, she slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a pounding on the door. FRAN is on the other side

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Open up, Nicole! I can smell that shit cooking! Open Up! Nicole. Nicole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is now passed out in the seat next to EVANS. He has approach plates (charts) folded and tucked between his sunglasses and eyes, creating a makeshift sleeping mask. lower jaw hangs open as his head bobs in deep sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret leans in through the cockpit door talking to Eva

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has Sleeping Beauty been out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS maintains a military posture as he monitors the pla progress. The flight is smooth and the sky appears clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) 26 minutes. We're going to start descending any second now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you'll need to wake... 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio interrupts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. Descend and maintain Flight Level 30 thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Descend and maintain 30 thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans dials 30,000 into the auto-pilot, but just as he ro the thumb switch to the "Descend" position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly the autopilot's Shut-Off SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP jolts awake and pushes up his sleeping "shades."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans grabs his yoke and pulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stabilizer feels really stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't force it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS does, we HEAR a big mechanical SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the noise) That came from the back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have very little trim control sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret, get everybody strapped in tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret runs to the PA, leaving the cockpit door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pulling right. Hard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! It's locked up, ease up on the trim don't... 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no trim at all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instrument panel LIGHTS UP like a Christmas tree -- A WARNING HORN BLARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost our hydraulics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls on his headset and keys his mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center, this is SouthJet 227, we've lost our hydraulics...and, ah shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power. Pull back the power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans pulls the throttles to idle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) ...we lost hydraulics and looks like...also our horizontal stabilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. Understand you've lost hydraulics and stabilizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on the back-up pumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans engages the emergency hydraulic pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center, that's affirm. We are in a descent, an uncontrolled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane starts to bank to the right, WHIP puts his hand against the wing-window to stay in his seat. EVANS grabs harness with both hands. The passengers shriek with terro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, do you wish to declare an emergency!? 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET stumbles into the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's belted in. Are we going down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane suddenly pitches up, begins to roll, and dives again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get belted in, everyone belt in. Brace position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET rushes to the bench in the galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip grabs his yoke and pulls. The plane inches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some control on my side! My plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whips keeps back pressure on his yoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stiff as hell. We're pitching up. Slowing a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, say your condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip continues to give orders to Evans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need drag. Throw out everything we've got. Speed brakes. Gear... (keys his mic) Uh, Center we're in a dive...lost vertical control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans deploys the landing gear and applies the speed brak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind ROARS as the gear doors drop. The airframe shake and rumbles violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there enough hydraulics to drop the gear? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gear's down. I don't think hydraulics is the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw out the flaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too fast for flaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to start dumping fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans quickly throws the "EMRG FUEL DUMP" switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airplane bucks and drops violently -- A chorus of terrified SCREAMS ERUPTS from the main cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip pulls on his yoke with all of his strength and the d shallows out a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. How do you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys his mic) Atlanta. This is SouthJet 227. We are in an uncontrolled dive, descending out of...shit I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to Whip) 21 thousand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) ...21 thousand. We are declaring an emergency! We are dumping fuel! We have a jammed stabilizer...or something. We need a block of altitude to work the problem...and a heading to the nearest airport! (YELLS to Evans) I'm starting to lose it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yoke pressure pulls Whip hard against his harness. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227. Hartsfield-Jackson International is 10 O'clock and 20 miles from your present position. Maintain block altitude, Flight Level 10 thousand through Flight Level 20 thousand. Turn left heading 260.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 260...we'll do our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting away from me! I can't hold...dump the flaps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yoke is ripping away from Whip's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO IT! 30 percent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans dumps in the flaps. The JR-88 slows dramatically an balloons up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bought us a little time. We need to revert to manual control. Your side first, pul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip is interrupted by the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Atlanta. Fuel dump is approved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans is confused and panicked, he throws his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans, look at me! Manual Reversion. Red lever, on the floor, far side of the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it up, turn it clockwise, push it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans does exactly that, then pulls back on his yoke -- nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! No control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, the plane pitches into a dive. Whip strains t hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let go! Can you reach mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans strains to reach Whip's Reversion Pull-Handle -- bu can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't reach it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans moves to release his harness, but Whip stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't! Stay strapped in! (calls over his shoulder) Margaret! Margaret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret tumbles into the cockpit, catching herself on Wh chair. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Whip. What's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get strapped into the jump-seat. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret opens the jump-seat and starts to pull on her harness. Throughout the scene she is struggling with her harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret, see that red lever on the floor next to my chair? The one that says, Manual Control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the count of three you pull it up, turn it clockwise, then push it back down. OK? You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With tears streaming down her cheeks, she gives Whip a br nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. One, two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip releases back pressure from his yoke, pushing it for -- the plane noses downward 20 degrees!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE TERRIFIED SHRIEKS come from the back. Margaret quick disengages then re-engages the large red handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip pulls back on his yoke. The plane pitches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. OK. We got something. It's still stiff as hell. Evans, put in some power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans pushes up the throttles. Whip gingerly applies pres to his stick. His face fills with worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It feels like the son of a bitch wants to nose over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly... WHAP! Whip's yoke flies out of his hands SLAMS forward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane banks right and drops! Margaret SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: (he pulls back the power)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, ATC comes on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Hartsfield-Jackson is eleven o'clock and niner miles. I see you below 10,000. How are you doing? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys his mic) Not good. You got anything closer? We're in a rapid dive here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, SouthJet 227. Uh...Clayton County is 2 miles at your 4 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. We're too high...we can't pitch for glide. We have no stabilizer control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, SouthJet 227.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane continues to drop, increasing its nose-down attitude and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pushes both of his feet forward, stretching his body get leverage as we can see him pulling on the yoke, tryin get the plane out of the dive it's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans is starting to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord, we're descending at 4,700 feet per minute, out of 7,000. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK! Here's what we're going to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I say, you retract the gear, retract the flaps and trim both ailerons. But every things gonna be opposite, so be sure to trim down. Margaret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trim down?! What are you gonna do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip takes Margaret's hand and puts it on the throttle levers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I ask for power, push both of these forward. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your son's name? 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say "I love you Trevor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean trim up?! Right? You want me to trim up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Trevor. Be a good boy. Mommy loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?! Why would I trim down?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna roll it. Ready? Here we go. I've got control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little barrel roll. Don't panic. Relax. Let it roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's body is fully extended as he pulls back on the yok and turns into a steep bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-force of the roll presses Evans away from the conso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret! Can you reach it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret bends forward and pulls the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3,000...I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it roll. I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip quickly retracts the speed brakes, then PUSHES HIS Y FULL FORWARD! The clumsy liner does a slow, ungraceful ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE WATCH as the PASSENGERS scream as the plane rolls over they are suspended upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JR-88 finishes its barrel-roll, skimming over suburba rooftops and trees. A CLOUD-TRAIL of Jet-A SPEWING from i wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the INVERTED PLANE ROARS overhead the CAMERA PANS to f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being rushed out of her apartment on a stretcher. The TWO PARAMEDICS and Fran (the landlord) instinctively duck as jet SCREAMS over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the sight of the jet) Jesus Christ! What the Fuck!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS hangs in his harness straps as dust and smoke swirl around him. The inverted wings make an EERIE WHISTLING SO as the plane SHUDDERS violently side-to-side. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lord Jesus! We're inverted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP reaches over and pulls the throttles back. He sudden seems strangely calm, comfortable with his fate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're level. We can maintain altitude like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRINA struggles to stay in her seat as she looks at the passengers hanging. She watches as a YOUNG BOY loses his grip and flops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRINA unhooks and flops to the ground. We follow her as s runs on the ceiling of the cabin towards the BOY. She get there and starts lifting him towards his FATHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ATC voice now plays loudly through the entire cockpit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, Atlanta Center. I see your position 4 and a half miles southeast of the airport. Descending out of 1,800. Are you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Whip a second to find the mic key on his inverte yoke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Atlanta...we're inverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a very pregnant pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, SouthJet 227...say again sir. Did you say inverted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS seems calmed by WHIP'S workaday attitude about thei insane tragedy. But suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR A HORRIBLE, METALLIC GRINDING SOUND as the engine become oil-deprived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're flying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans pulls the Fire Bottle handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip BARKS at air traffic control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 227, three miles, and one o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) We're not gonna make that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small white church on a hill -- 100 yards past the chur is a soy bean field and a two-lane blacktop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) There's a field and a road ah...we're gonna put it down in that field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, SouthJet 227.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS is breathing heavy as his face is beet red from the blood rushing to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans deploys the right engine Fire Bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight hundred, descending...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have enough speed to fly!

dialogues.speaker: WHIP PULLS HARD ON HIS YOKE
dialogues.text: STARTS TO RIGHT ITSELF. Whip yanks back the throttles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans and Whip deploy every bit of drag they can think of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SouthJet 227, altitude 500 indicated, descending. Do you concur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow WHIP's eye line that takes us off the control p and to the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD WE SEE -- the landscape and the ch steeple getting closer and closer. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane does a clumsy roll to the right -- AND GETS STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS pushes the power to full thrust AND THE PLANE FINIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRINA is still struggling to strap herself in to her jumpseat. The plane rolls! She sees Camelia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. -- Camelia is tossed across a row of SCREAMING passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRINA loses her grip and is violently thrown against the galley wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a rag doll, CAMELIA is hurled down the cabin aisle a the plane plummets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trina slides across the galley floor and CRACKS her head the jumpseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip frantically spins the trim wheel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR A HORRIFIC, METALLIC GRINDING -- followed by a TERRIFYING SILENCE -- RIGHT ENGINE STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unnerving quiet descends over the passenger cabin. The only SOUND is the wind RUSHING past the air-frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, incredulous) Are we gliding? 39.

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE DROPPING RAPIDLY TOWARD THE GROUND
dialogues.text: GATHERED NEAR A POND IN THE CHURCHYARD SCATTER -- some ar wearing long white robes.

dialogues.speaker: EVANS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in a final, ironic, cosmic gesture --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE Whip's lower torso being pulled from the wreckage There is swirling SMOKE AND DUST, SMALL FIRES -- 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evans strapped in his chair, bleeding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret SOBS uncontrollably --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's being pulled up a grassy hillside. In the distance WHIP can see the shattered airplane lying in a crater. Fi smoulder around the impact zone. Passengers are joined by first responders as they frantically carry, drag and walk injured and the dead from the plane. WHIP sees a fire tru fly by him, down the grassy slope towards the burning pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING UP at the sky -- WE SEE black, oily SMOKE billowi across the shattered church steeple --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE GLIMPSE PEOPLE rushing past, some are wearing white flowing robes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING UP at the ceiling of an ambulance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO EMTS are urgently attending to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A halogen overhead light and an air-conditioning vent -- brown-stained acoustic ceiling tiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR the rhythmic BEEP of a heart monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's eyes open to see the halogen overhead lights of a hospital room. He turns his head slightly to see the flic of a TV with no sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news show runs a loop of eye witness cell phone footage the plane turning over and crashing belly down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN who has been watching the TV turns to see that WHIP awake. The MAN turns off the TV, gets up and approaches WHIP's bedside. WHIP knows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE ANDERSON is a late 50's former military pilot who carries that familiar air of Texas comfort and entitlemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feelin' Whip? Initial reports look like you pulled some move up there, kid. You saved a lot of lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is moved by the first realization of survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE moves close to deliver the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 souls on board including the flight crew, and 96 of them survived the crash. Six people died. 2 crew, 4 passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 passengers. Are the rest badly hurt? Who'd we lose on the crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE enters the room. CHARLIE nods to her. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, protocol is the NTSB has to make the first contact with you and the agent is here. Let me go get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE ducks out of the room. WHIP is alone and still getting his bearings. He goes to scratch his head and catches sight of his left hand. It's swollen and sore --h wrist is bandaged with a splint-brace. He now looks at bo of his hands in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP hears a muffled conversation that gets clearer as do images of MANY PEOPLE entering the room. A POLICE OFFICER accompanies a DOCTOR and TWO NTSB AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NTSB AGENT holds a small voice recorder towards WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain William Whitaker? Nod if you can hear me and understand me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Craig Matson from the NTSB and I'm required as the lead on the Go Team to make an initial contact with you after a major incident like the one you had today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods as his senses are getting sharper.

dialogues.speaker: NTSB OFFICER
dialogues.text: You are in a hospital in South Atlanta. Are you aware that you were piloting a plane that went down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a doctor here who can explain your medical situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP offers a "thumbs up" gesture. The DOCTOR steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Doctor Kenan and the good news is that you are in good condition. You did suffer a concussion which is the reason you have a bit of blurred vision and a headache. You have numerous lacerations around your left eye. We're going to leave the patch on for a few days as a precaution. But it seems your eye is OK. MRI's show strained tendons in your left knee and ankle but you didn't break any bones. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some deep bruising in your left thigh and you have a few torn ligaments in your left wrist. Nothing serious. So as soon as we clear you from the concussion, and you feel well enough -- you can go home. That could be a day, could be 3 days. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP quietly nods. The DOCTOR leaves and WHIP begins to study his body. His left leg is wrapped, his left wrist h a splint-brace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask too much of you tonight, but as I said, the NTSB is required to make initial contact. How much do you remember about the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks at the NTSB OFFICER and slowly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember everything until the crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's voice is failing him as his throat is sore and dry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Mr. Whitaker, that's fine. I am required to inform you that this incident did result in the loss of life. (checks an index card) The most current information states that of the 102 souls on board we lost 6. 2 crew members and 4 passengers. 59 people were treated and released. 37 people remain in the hospital and 3 of those cases are listed as critical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who on the crew died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two flight attendants; (checks a note card) Camelia Satou and Katerina Marquez

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP tries to exhale as the loss of TRINA sinks in. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rep from your Pilot's Union, Mr. Anderson, will act as our contact for you. It's important to follow your Union's guidance on press and media. The pilot's union works closely with the NTSB. So, I'm gonna head out. Good luck Mr. Whitaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods as the NTSB OFFICER leaves with the police and other officials in tow. CHARLIE returns to WHIP's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Trina Marquez. We spent some time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently she wasn't strapped in. A survivor reported that she was assisting a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE tries to put a reassuring hand on WHIP's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Margaret Thomason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his notes) Broken collar bone, cuts, banged up, but she's okay. She's here too. Ken Evans your copilot took a bad shot to the head. They're keepin' him in a coma to let the brain swelling go down. He's listed as critical, but we feel good about him. He's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP lets that information land as his head is swirling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flying a desk now. I'm a regional rep for the IAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the rep for the pilots' union? 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm one of a few union reps for the southeast. When your plane went down all the reps got a page and since I know you I shot my hand up and said I wanted to come and be the first face you'd see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad it's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP starts to weep as he needs to begin the long process expressing this trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you too, Cowboy. You're gonna be okay. We're gonna take care of you. That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods as he wipes his eyes on his heavily bandaged ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The union will put out a statement on your behalf. Condolences to the families who lost loved ones and gratitude to the brave men and women on the flight crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know you and Deana have been divorced for a while but maybe she and your son...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how old's he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you weren't even married when we flew for Delta. We're dinosaurs, Whip. Do you want me to reach out to Deana and see if she and Will want to come? Any family you want here, we'll get them here, stat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP thinks about his long since fractured family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll call her. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, I have your phone and some of your personal effects from the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE has a zip-locked bag with his phone, keys, sungla and wallet. WHIP looks at them, odd to see them encased i plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your clothes are toast. Do you need me to get you some stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm okay. I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head out, let you get some rest. I'm coming back. You'll see plenty of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE hands WHIP his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Charlie, I really... (Whip begins to crack) It means a lot to me that you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Get some rest now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, that plane was fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. The way you landed that plane was nothing short of a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods trying to pull it together. CHARLIE pats WHIP's shoulder before he leaves. WHIP sits up and pulls his pho from the plastic bag. Dials, waits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling...Harling...yeah, it's Whip. I'm in a hospital in South Atlanta...what? You know where I am? Okay well fuck...yeah, I'm okay. What? Well, I'm looking to get outta here...hopefully tomorrow. Yeah. But, listen, I need you to bring me something to wear. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- clothes -- and smokes, I really need smokes. Tee shirt, sweat pants....Harling? I'll put you on the visiting list. Yeah...and smokes. Just be low key, no fucking around, Harling. Cigarettes. Okay? I need cigarettes. Yeah. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP closes his eyes and exhales. He now stares at the fo of the bed for a long, long moment. WHIP squeezes his eye shut tight -- holding back tears. Then quietly, as if whispering a prayer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stones "Sympathy for the Devil" kicks up as we wait..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors split open and HARLING MAYS steps out. HARLING a pony tail and a goatee and is probably wearing a Tommy Bahama button down shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow HARLING as he strides down the hall. With ear b in, HARLING points a Sanyo pistol-shaped cam corder at th ATTENDING NURSE at the nurses' station, recording her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the list baby girl. Check the list for Mr. Mays. Harling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stones continue to wail as Harling strolls on, adjust the duffel bag he has slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING stands in the doorway looking in. He sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MORNING NURSE is helping WHIP to stand. HARLING point his camcorder at WHIP and the NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: If this is gonna turn into a sponge bath, I'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING immediately goes to WHIP and supports him. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Harling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right honey, I'm on the list. Harling Mays. Some say they Harling knew me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING boxes her out. She steps away.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honey can you hustle us a couple of daiquiris and a cocktail weenie? On second thought just bring the booze. I brought my own weenie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction as the NURSE collects the trash and towels. HARLING focuses his camcorder on the NURSE and leaves WHI an unsteady stance. HARLING films her and comments...

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's offended, and she should be. I'm a pig. And I hate me. That's what we have in common Nurse Ratched...we both hate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gone. HARLING turns to WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whip? What the fuck my man? They're sayin', "Sweet Jesus, what a fuckin' stud that pilot is." You're a hero, no shit. You will never pay for another drink in this life time. There is crazy news people all over, look at this shit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING helps WHIP to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From WHIP's window we can see a slew of news vans with si towers as well as reporters milling about -- a small zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING and WHIP stare for a moment at the circus below. WHIP doesn't last long and slowly returns to the bed as HARLING continues to gawk. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classic hero worship, you're a rock star man. You gotta see the video I've got -- I'm making a doc about you, well us, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING pulls an iPad out of his knapsack and flips it op He lets a collection of videos run...

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is outside your condo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On HARLING's iPad we see footage of PRESS swarming outsid WHIP's condo. We also see the crash scene footage.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look that's me, and that`s Mark Mellon...you know that douchey talking haircut from local Atlanta channel 3? I said a few words. Just straight talk, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's hands shake as he grabs the bed frame. HARLING tak notice and stashes the iPad...

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay Captain Whitaker? Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING helps him get settled. We see the beads of sweat WHIP's lip and forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meds they're giving me are fucking me up -- I'm all shaky and dried out. I can't sleep good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING immediately picks up the small paper cup that hol WHIP's pain meds. He fishes out the two pills and stares them. HARLING shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aprazolam? That's generic Xanax and this Hydrocodone is generic Vicodin. It's shit, prolly Canadian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING casually tosses the pills down his gullet and expertly swallows them without water. He grabs WHIP's medical chart and scours it as he prattles on...

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We want the premium stuff. Blue label...not the fucking well shit. Where's the dihydromorphinone? 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or just some fucking Palladone would suffice. What is this? Fucking amateur hour over here? Get that goddamned doctor in here. You just saved a 100 people from death, they should get your fuckin' meds right. (calls to the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Harling, leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got my message and decided not to call me back? Did you bring me smokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided to come by instead. And yes I got your fucking message and yes I brought you smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING hands WHIP a pack of smokes from his pocket. He a pulls out a carton of smokes from his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here is a fresh carton, enjoy. You fucking earned it -- you smoke your nuts off, champion. If I were you I'd fire up right here in the God damn room. Fuck'em, you're immortal, you're a fucking God man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP motions with his hands to "calm down."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Whip. It's just...this is big time, man. You're a hero in a time when we really need heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Harling...Six people died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 people lived! When are you gonna take yes for an answer? Pick up the phone, man. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING pulls something from his vest pocket and puts it WHIP'S hand. WHIP looks at it and back at HARLING. 51.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's a pint of Smirnoff and a few Red Bulls. You know what I'm sayin'? I know my customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING continues to pull items from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling, take the vodka with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING freezes his frenzied energy with this odd command

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Take the vodka? Dude, are you insane? I'm gonna just tuck it in the bottom of your-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the fucking vodka!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING hears him this time and raises his hand and nods, putting the VODKA back in his own duffel. HARLING tosses tee shirt, sweat pants and flip-flops on the bed, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay man. Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING holds up a silk Japanese Happi Coat, with elabora stitching depicting colorful birds flying around Mt. Fuji

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm tired man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out. You rest up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta come and get me, tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls his keys from the bag that CHARLIE gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are my keys. Go to the condo and bring me some nice clothes I can wear, my phone charger and grab the veal outta my fridge. It's marked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The veal? 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the veal that's in my freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done and done. What time you need me here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send the mayday and you're outta here in 7 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a few stroke mags too. I've been in hospitals. I know what you need. JUGS, HOT MILFS in heat. ASSMASTERS. You should just stroke it all day. You're a hero -- know what I'm saying? If I was in here I'd be jerkin' it all day long. See, there's a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING puts his hand on WHIP's forehead in an attempt to reassure him. A quiet moment before HARLING slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP wakes up in a cold sweat. He is breathing heavy as h scans the room. LIGHTENING FLASHES from outside the windo Thunder RUMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks to the night stand where we see a pack of nico gum has been chewed through. WHIP uses his hands to get t the edge of the bed. He roots through the duffle bag that HARLING left and finds a pack of smokes and a Bic lighter still in its package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Determined to smoke, WHIP eyes a WHEEL CHAIR that has bee placed next to his bed. Leaning against the wheelchair is medical cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing his Happi Coat (or robe), WHIP limps in to the em hallway with the use of his cane. He checks the quiet corridor as he begins his quest... 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open, and no one appears to be on the oth side. Now WHIP fights to push the heavy door open again t slip through. A hand grabs the door and holds it. WHIP walks into the sanctity of the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the owner of the helping hand was NICOLE who retu to a quiet spot along the wall of the stairwell as she demurely smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP leans his cane against the wall and carefully pulls pack of smokes from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think anyone would have the same devious thought about using the fire stairs to have a smoke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE smiles and looks down, awkward around men when she not loaded. She drops her cigarette which we see was bare smoked as she maneuvers to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. I'll be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers her a cigarette, she takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to talk. Be nice to just smoke with someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they do. They sit in silence as the stairwell fills u with smoke. After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you on the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP studies her, she's beautiful in an exhausted way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was. Were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you sitting? 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up near the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again it falls silent as we let them smoke and think in t sanctity of the fire stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE breaks their silence.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Tobacco's but an Indian weed, Grows green in the morn, cut down at eve; It shows our decay, We are but clay;...I love the smell of Nicotina in the morning. Smells like...victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a metallic rattle and WHIP and NICOLE look to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flee dear comrades! Really, wait for me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GAUNT YOUNG MAN makes his way to their landing. He is dressed in a hospital gown and carrying an I.V. pole on w hangs a small bag of clear liquid. The man's hair has completely left him. His skin is gray. Eyes hollowed from his battle with cancer.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Can I bum a smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP offers him a cigarette. He takes it and fires it up with a lighter he keeps stowed in the pocket of his gown.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should quit, my cancer might get cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joke. You guys in the plane crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks at the ground as the GAUNT YOUNG MAN studies h

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: (it hits him) You're the fucking pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole gives Whip a look. 55.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I saw you on TV. Holy shit, man. Tough deal, but you walked away or it looks like you limped away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm lucky. Goin' home tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Home. Home for me is the basement, they keep cancer treatment in the basement. I'm livin' here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're living here?

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: No. I'm dying here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of cancer?

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Fibro-mixzoid sarcoma, soft tissue sarcoma. Very rare, God chose me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAUNT YOUNG MAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God chose you? You believe in God?

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah bitch. You're a stupid fucker if you don't believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GOD topic has silenced the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As soon as you realize that the random events in your life are God...you will live a much better life. You spend your life believing that you have all the control over what happens. Bullshit. The plane you're flying goes down? Out of your control. God gives you cancer. I have no control over that. Did God give me cancer? You bet your ass God gave me cancer. You think if I begged for cancer God would have given it to me? 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...because I assure you I have begged for God to take it away - and guess what? I have no control over that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAUNT YOUNG MAN smokes the cig to the nub and rubs the remains against the smooth concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get another smoke? What's wrong with you honey? You're beautiful, do you know that? Do I scare you? People either have to pretend they don't see me or they're drawn to me. It's funny because people see me as being close to the other side -- they feel like I have power or wisdom. They think I have the answers. Who knows? Maybe I do. Death gives you perspective. I lived my life so indecisive, in a haze. But now that I'm dying everything is so clear. It all makes sense somehow. I'm sorry but I can't get over how beautiful you are? Look at your arm, you an addict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE looks at him. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: What do you do in the world Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, what a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much. I was a photographer and then I was a masseuse and I wash hair at a salon sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Where is it? I'll come by, I'm easy, you can wash my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you're gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE laughs to keep from weeping. 57.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not. You're not gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men watch as NICOLE quietly cries, it's powerful.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know her.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit, I do. Random act of God? Don't think so. Survive a plane crash to meet a gorgeous girl in a stairwell. Fuck you man. (he reflects, then...) I'm sure they're looking for me. My family just showed up from Utah. You know it's bad when they start flying in. Every morning is special now, I'm so grateful. It's a trip, wish I could bottle this feeling I have...about how beautiful every breath of life is..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAUNT YOUNG MAN starts laughing. WHIP joins him.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get a smoke for the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a pack.

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, I'll pass them out in the cancer ward. Take care Nicole, you're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GAUNT YOUNG MAN leaves, clanging away with his I.V. p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE wipes away her tears, we see her hospital bracelet well as her track marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemo brain. Chemo makes you pretty foggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call it chemo brain, my mom used to slur her words and get all chatty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom had cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breast cancer, she was only 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why'd that guy ask you if you were gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I flat-lined twice in the ambulance. Heroin addicts who use needles tend to die. Especially women for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a pamphlet to prove it. A girl from AA just came to see me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy was a trip. He made it feel like, I dunno...we were the last people left on the planet.. (drops her smoke) ...and together we should save the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE steps on her cigarette and puts the nub in her poc She begins to leave. WHIP stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where should we live? If we're gonna save the world, where should we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP laughs. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE's laugh tapers off as she senses his honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you wanna come visit? It's luxurious. (silence between them) I live in Bankhead, it's south Atlanta, near the bus station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luxurious bus station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come visit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. What's your address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She measures him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live at the Georgian Gardens on Taylor street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgian Gardens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are you staying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to stay as long as I can but I don't have insurance to cover rehab. I'll prolly be out tomorrow. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. And you're a masseuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of masseuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been every kind of masseuse there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is strong tension between them. An orderly busts through the down the stairs. This breaks their stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP leaves NICOLE where he found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is wheeled out of a service exit by an ORDERLY who a holds the duffle bag of WHIP's stuff around his neck. Whi longer wears the eye patch but has a butterfly bandage ov his left eye brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING jumps out of his 2001 Cadillac STS and immediatel takes over, grabbing the duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ORDERLY tries to hand WHIP a medical file. HARLING snatches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks Mike. (Harling tips him) Here's 20 American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Good luck, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING hugs WHIP who hangs on tight. The ORDERLY spins t chair around and heads back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING uses his key fob to remotely pop the trunk and st Whip's duffel. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how they get the Stones out of Madison Square Garden, man. 4 smoked black limos fly outta the VIP driveway and the fans jump on the limos...mayhem. Those limos? Empty. Meanwhile, Mick and the boys go out the service exit into delivery vans -- casual, rock star type shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING helps him into the front seat and they pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stones, "Gimme Shelter" starts to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 As they drive off, we see media mayhem collected in fr the hospital. Trucks with towers, cameramen, stringers an newscasters add to catering trucks and coffee stands as t vultures wait for the carrion of sound bytes and footage survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip watches through the rear window -- the "Media Circus disappears as the Caddy rounds a corner. The back seat is piled with Whip's clothes, most of them still on hangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING lights a cigarette and hands one to WHIP who take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't find any suitcases so I just put your shit in grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING pulls a cold Becks from a cooler on the floor of back seat and uses a bottle opener that's been screwed to dash of his car next to the radio to open the beer. He offers the beer to WHIP who waves it off. HARLING gladly keeps it for himself... "Gimme Shelter" continues to play

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you're stayin' with me down on University, right? It's nice. A lotta young people...good vibe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling tosses Whip a freezer bag marked:"VEAL" -- Whip begins to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm gonna go to the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fucking farm? 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's place. I can't stay at my condo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you sold that fucking place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I wanna stay at the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not. Just take me to the airport to get my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip finishes opening the freezer bag -- it's full of cas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING starts to laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 Veal? Really? Don't you know the 58 first place every two-bit thief looks is in the freezer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's BUICK turns off the blacktop past a small weathere billboard: WHITAKER CROP DUSTING. Also a real estate "FOR SALE" sign is posted in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip pulls into a long, dirt driveway that approaches a o story farm house. He gets out of the car. With his cane i one hand, he uses his free hand to toss the grocery bags close to the steps and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP ambles in and we see the interior of the house bears fading patina of a proud American Family. We see PHOTOS - WHIP in his NAVAL FLYER UNIFORM. A GROUP MILITARY PHOTO - SQUADRON of NAVAL FLIERS on a carrier. WHIP's PARENTS nex to the farm house. WHIP's FATHER stands next to WHIP who holding his infant son. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP empties his pockets onto the desk top. His keys, wal and his cell phone are placed next to an old rotary phone attached to an old answering machine. WHIP plugs in his c phone charge, dials in for his messages and puts it in "speaker mode" as we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have 127 messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message one..."Captain Whitaker, this is Jim Court I'm with CNN. We'd like to schedule an interview..." (he deletes that message) Message two..."This is NBC affiliate KGAT in Athens we're looking to contact William J. Whitaker for..." (he deletes and moves on) Message three..."Captain Whitaker, this is Karen James, media relations with the pilots' union..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP again deletes the message and decides to just shut t phone down. He continues to empty his pockets. In his jac pocket he finds a prescription bottle of pain pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP holds it up, opens it and pours a few out in his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pours the pain pills into the toilet. He then opens medicine cabinet and starts to empty all of the bottles i the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP goes to the collection of liquor bottles next to the sink that act as a makeshift bar. He picks up a bottle of vodka. He unscrews the cap and sniffs the contents. He slowly tips the bottle and pours it into the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip opens the refrigerator and removes an assortment of beers. He pops them open and pours them in the sink. The faucet running to offset the pungent smell. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip opens a dresser drawer and finds a couple of zip-loc bags of "bud" hidden under the socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip dumps the weed into the toilet and FLUSHES it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette dangles from WHIP's mouth as he ferrets aroun the room, showing the focus and determination of a serial killer cleaning his kill site. He finds rolling papers, roaches, more liquor and weed -- he reaches into the Shel Bag that's hanging next to the shotgun rack and finds ano "pint."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip opens the freezer to put in his frozen dinner and hi "packet of veal" and finds another fifth of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours the vodka in the sink and tosses the bottle into trash -- which is piled high with empties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen window, Whip sees the farm's old weathered barn. Whip furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP slides open the heavy barn doors to reveal -- A VINT CESSNA 172 -- covered in dust and bird shit from the year stagnant storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP lights a smoke as he marvels at the little piece of aviation history resting in his barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip walks past the plane and starts to examine the large two-story, open-ceilinged barn that is junked full of far equipment and old furniture. He finds...

dialogues.speaker: A WALL OF PHOTOS
dialogues.text: HIS GRANDFATHER, FATHER and WHIP pose next to the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROP DUSTER acts as the background for a picture with a year old WHIP and his father next to a small plane. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of pictures feature the PLANE in flight and SHOT TAKEN FROM THE PLANE, aerials of the farm, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP holds the framed shot of he and his dad as he walks to the plane, resting his arm on the wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls himself from the wall of photos and stares at stuff. We recognize what must be the stuff he took from h house after his divorce. We see bikes, weights and fishin gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip rummages through a box of things packed from his hom office. Trophies, sports memorabilia, citations -- A PHOT HE AND HIS WIFE from happier times. THEIR WEDDING PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Whip comes upon A FRAMED BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO of he Charlie in their younger, Navy days -- wearing flight sui and standing on a carrier flight deck in front of an F-14 Tomcat. Big smiles, full of hotshot pilot swagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP puts the photo back and spots his golf bag. He roots out a pint of cheap vodka from the inner pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next he finds a fifth of bourbon in his bicycle saddle ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the workbench and removes a couple of bottles the paint shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 Whip dumps out the liquor onto the grass as he hobbles to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 WHIP uses just his cane now as he drags a garbage bag 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: empty liquor bottles to his garbage cans. He tosses the b of empties in a can. His work done, WHIP lights a smoke a stares at the empty fields that run forever as does the landscape of his mind. He quietly tries to grasp the horr he endured and the reality of his survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the microwave beep and WHIP retrieves a frozen dinner. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP sits at the coffee table eating his frozen dinner wh watching news coverage of the crash.  PHONE RINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is startled by the phone that never rings. He snaps the TV using the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is in no hurry to answer the phone as the old time r continues. WHIP goes to the desk where the phone rests an he watches the old answering machine click on. We hear...

dialogues.speaker: WHIP'S FATHER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You've reached the Whitaker Crop Dusting Company, flying lessons and plane rides. Please leave a message and it will be returned. Thank you.  VOICE MAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think that was the beep. Hey Cowboy, it's Charlie again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP reaches for the phone but decides to just listen to CHARLIE...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking to voicemail) I'm back in town and I stopped by the hospital tonight but they said you went home...so I guess you're feelin' pretty good, but um we went out to your condo and the manager said you had not returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE sits at a beautiful wooden table in a modern glas walled office above a baseball field. The table is popula with casually-dressed businessmen and lawyers as this aft hours meeting was called on the fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH SCENE PHOTOS and FILES fill the table top. We also a photo or two of the WHITAKER FARM.  VOICE MAIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you may be with relatives, which I understand. I was really hoping to see you for breakfast. I'm at the St. Regis downtown. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an executive buffet on the 16th floor - 10 o'clock, okay? If you get this, please come. Some important stuff to cover. Be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stands still as a beep sounds, ending the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The executive buffet is a staple at the ST. REGIS. A long center table with silver trays houses eggs and breakfast meats. Fruit, bagels and a staff of servers cater to the business elite of Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
