dialogues.text: CHARLIE ANDERSON sits at a corner table with HUGH LANG, a young, well-dressed African American man. CHARLIE and HUG are chatting in jocular spirit when WHIP approaches, walk much more confidently with his cane.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip, hey buddy. Glad you got my message. Grab a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP studies HUGH as he pulls out his chair.  CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip this is Hugh Lang; he's an attorney from Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH stands and shakes hands with WHIP.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you Captain Whitaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP and HUGH remain standing, both feeling a little "alp  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddown. Coffee? (Whip nods, sits) Miss, can we get some fresh coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and nods. She's off to get the coffee.  CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just talking about your copilot's wife. She told a newspaper that "God landed that plane." 68.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God landed the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP just stares at the two men who have large buffet pla surrounding them.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I too believe that God landed that plane. The same way I believe that God should hit the buffet, the turkey sausage is excellent.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good with coffee.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Len Caldwell was really trying to get here this morning. (Whip seems lost) Len is the president of the pilots' union and he wanted to be here with us and meet with you but they wanted him at the crash site. So..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is quiet, anxious to hear the purpose of the meeting  CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip, as you know, when a plane crashes, the NTSB sends a "go team" to the crash site immediately.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find the flight data recorders?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes they found them, perfectly intact.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. That solves everything. The recorders will tell the story. Why do we need a lawyer from Chicago?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh's an attorney who specializes in criminal negligence-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminal negligence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS returns with the coffee. It's quiet as they wait for her to finish. She does. 69.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death demands responsibility. Six dead on that plane, someone has to pay.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane fell apart at 30 thousand feet.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airline will try to prove equipment failure. Which would make the manufacturer responsible. The manufacturer of the plane will try to prove poor maintenance of the equipment by the airline.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or pilot error.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to fly that plane inverted, that means upside down, Hugh. Do you get the picture? 100 passengers hanging upside down, 500 feet off the ground. Do you have any idea what that sounds like?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I heard the black box last night.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a pilot?  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you don't know what the fuck you're talking about.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh's on our team and it's the NTSB's ball game. They run the investigation and they will ultimately rule on the cause.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They interview the entire flight crew and the passengers. They hold PUBLIC HEARINGS-
WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, what do I need to know? I'm already tired of this guy.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NTSB `go team' collects blood, skin and hair from the flight crew for a toxicology report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP studies the two men, trying to read their poker hand  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did they do that?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hospital. It's the first thing they do. Do you remember having your blood drawn on the night of the crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks at CHARLIE and then to HUGH...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have the results of these blood tests?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS checks in.  WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else for you gentlemen?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just see warm cinnamon rolls come out?  WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me one wouldya? Actually bring me two, okay sweetie?  WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence as they wait for her to clear out.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An initial report shows alcohol in your bloodstream at a level of .24. In the U.S. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- one of the most lenient drunk driving countries in the world -- you go to jail for driving with a number over .08. And by driving, I mean a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all digest the information as the WAITRESS delivers cinnamon rolls. She leaves. It's still quiet.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? I had a beer the night before I flew. And what...That made the tail of the plane explode?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Separate issues Whip-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a lawyer.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh is your lawyer.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a bigger lawyer. A lawyer who understands that I flew a broken plane and without me at that stick there'd be 102 funerals, not 6.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about prison not funerals. Somebody has-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To write checks, well it's not me I promise you that. And as long as they're writing checks, write me one because someone put me in a broken plane. I'd love a check.  CHARLIE EASY WHIP-  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tox report states that you were drunk and high on cocaine, felonies punishable by 24 years in jail. And if your intoxication is proven to have caused the death of the 4 passengers you'll get 4 counts of manslaughter. That could be life in prison. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I now do my job on your behalf and kill this tox report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is listening. CHARLIE tries to reign it in.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll get it done, Whip. It's what his entire life is about. Trust me, trust him. (Whip stares at Hugh) Don't worry Whip, you're gonna walk away the hero you deserve to be.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried, Charlie. I promise you that. No one could have landed that plane like I did, no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 The WAITRESS returns with a coffee pot. WHIP leaves. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on TV -- A SPLIT SCREEN -- CNN's PIERS MORGAN on on side of the screen asking questions of JIM TILMON, an aviation expert.

dialogues.speaker: WE NOW SEE A PHOTO OF WHIP IN HIS SOUTHJET AIRLINE UNIFOR
dialogues.text: PIERS MORGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tilmon, we wanna play a portion of the black box that all of the news outlets have grabbed hold of...  WHIP (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I ask for power, push both of these forward. Got it? What's your son's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER steps up to serve WHIP...  BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you have?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get an orange juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER leaves to grab the orange juice. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TELEVISION -- The transcription and AUDIO of the cockpit recording continues...

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: WHIP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Say "I love you Trevor."

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: WHIP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The black box.

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I love you Trevor. Be a good boy. Mommy loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER returns with the orange juice.  BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a double shot of Stoli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER nods and turns in acknowledgement of the or  PIERS MORGAN (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That audio paints a strong picture. Captain Whitaker is surely a hero in my opinion.  JIM TILMON (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. However, every incident is different. The actions of the pilots on SouthJet 227 will be heavily scrutinized. It's protocol for any investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER returns with a frosted glass and pours two shots over the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP downs the vodka in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OTHER BARTENDER has the remote and starts searching f more coverage of the crash. He stops at a local report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER gives a lead in at the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Kevin, it's still chaotic here at the site. Apparently a small ministry was conducting services near to where the plane came down. So the scene here is a mix of survivors and first responders, I was able to catch up with an actual passenger moments ago...

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG SHORT HAIRED BLONDE MAN GIVES HIS ACCOUNT
dialogues.text: PASSENGER 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in a nose dive and people were screaming and yelling and then the plane turned upside down and we had to hold on to our seat belts to keep from falling out of our chairs -- I saw one kid fall to the floor and this flight attendant picked him up and handed him to his dad...I didn't see her again.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: More details and more reports of the casualties are continuing to fly around. I can tell you that there appears to be many, many survivors. That's all I have for now. Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another reporter has a passenger's account.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rebecca, surviving passengers are being put in ambulances, police cruisers and even first responder vehicles and they are being taken to local hospitals for treatment. Some of the injured appear serious and it's safe to assume at this point that there are at least a few fatalities. Let's roll the tape of the passenger I caught up with earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN with SHORT DARK HAIR explains his experience. 75.  PASSENGER 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We turned like a corkscrew and all I could think was, "this is really happening, I'm going to die" and then all of a sudden the plane was upside down but steady and the pilot must have known how to fly it that way. He flipped it back over and landed it hard.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Obviously a harrowing ordeal for those on the troubled plane. This is Callie J Kenner for News 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third Reporter gets a FEMALE NEIGHBOR's perspective.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Folks in the houses that border this field came running from their houses...  NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was thunder at first. But it shook the ground hard. Thunder don't do like that. I ran outside and I could hear people yelling and I could see a small fire at first. I just took the dogs and headed down there. Then I saw the plane crumpled on the ground. I never seen nothing like that in my life.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Just like that plane, this community is shattered. Folks here remain on edge as media trucks continue to line their small road and crowd the field where the plane still lies. Back to you, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news light shines on a lone reporter who stands atop a small hill above the crash field. 76.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: We're gonna take another look at the cell phone footage that captured the last moments of SouthJet's Flight 227.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the PLANE levels off and smacks down in the field, return to REPORTER #4 in the crash field.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH SITE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Many hours have passed since the footage you just watched but the crash site remains active as investigators work through the night. Using flood lights and miners' caps, teams continue to comb the crash field looking for the answers to the hard questions as to what brought down SouthJet's flight 227. Those answers remain in darkness as do the broken pieces of the aircraft. Hopefully sunlight will bring answers. For now this is Kent Johnson reporting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 12-pack of beer hits the passenger seat as Whip climbs behind the wheel. Whip cracks open a "handle" (half-gallo of vodka and takes a liberal pull. Whip's shoulders relax the alcohol kicks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 After a moment, he starts the car, shifts into gear -- another huge slug of vodka -- and pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip is at the wheel. A cigarette in one hand, an open be in the other. He cruises slowly -- searching street signs with his beer-buzzed eyes.  WHIP (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor street, Taylor st...ah, here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip rolls the Buick to a stop and scans the street. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP spots a SIGN: "Georgian Gardens Apartments" Suddenly NICOLE flies into frame and tosses a box into the back of Toyota. She hustles off leaving the hatchback open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 WHIP raises an eyebrow, and drives toward the building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP parks his car at a fire hydrant right in front of NICOLE's building and gets out with his cane. He pops a f beer and looks at the building, looking for a proper entrance. He notices Fran walking quickly along the secon story balcony -- carrying a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip thinks nothing of it and begins casually poking thro the stuff in Nicole's car -- a random collection of junk including clothes and photographs -- mostly of rock bands performing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, WHIP HEARS an argument escalating between Fran and NICOLE.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The guy in Unit 1 just told me you stayed here last night?!

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Franny relax, I'm just getting my shit outta here, okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What about the rent! YOU OWE ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP does a decent job of making his way up the exterior staircase. That beer is making his leg feel a little bett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP moves more aggressively up the stairs as the ARGUMEN GROWS LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who do you think broke down this fucking door to let the paramedics in there? Huh?! -- You gotta pay for all this. 78.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Just let me get my shit and get outta here. I will pay you when I can.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I know, just take a shower with me. How hard is that? C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No. I'm not doin' that.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: If I had a bag a dope you'd be on your knees in my shower right now, right? Come on...

dialogues.speaker: FRAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Gimme the camera, for collateral. What's it worth?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No fucking way! I will kill you if you touch this camera! I will pay for all of this! I will pay, okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP crests the top of the staircase to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN, the landlord, wielding a baseball bat as he berates NICOLE. NICOLE has her full-bodied 35 MM camera hanging f a strap around her neck. FRAN points the bat at her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip WHACKS Fran with his cane.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doin'!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN stumbles and falls as the bat goes flying to the gro and rolls away. WHIP licks the foaming top of his excited beer. 79.  FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives Whip a puzzled LOOK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip jabs him again with his cane.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your fucking hands off her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE who is crying, now laughs in relief. She can't bel it. "America's Hero" has just come to her rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP moves to comfort her..  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? (SHE NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this all the stuff you want from here?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods again, recovering) Just this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a camera tripod and a box of broken portfol with photos dripping out.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, start taking that stuff down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN has gotten up and stands a safe distance from WHIP..  FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She owes me 1100 bucks! Plus damages!  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna spend a thousand bucks suing her and get jack shit? Or do you want to make a cash deal with me?  FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me 700 in cash.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a creep...with your baseball bat bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip flings his beer at Fran's head, then pulls out his billfold. 80.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorts through his cash) I'll give you 400 in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip throws the money on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN sorts the options...none...he tentatively bends down picks up the cash. Keeping a wary eye on Whip.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy. Now help her get that box in her car.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...my car doesn't run. It won't start. I'm taking this with me.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your car doesn't run? What were you gonna do?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I...I was... I don't know what I was gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran smirks. Whip drills Fran with his eyes...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with deliberate malice) Then put the fucking box in my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN's smirk fades. He relents and picks up the box as WH grabs the lighter shoulder bag and they head downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE stares out the window as the city disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls a beer from the box and offers it to Nicole. NICOLE smiles, thinks about it...she shakes her head, "no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pops the top and takes a drink.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks to her, she to him. They begin to laugh at the absurdity. When it subsides...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE nods. A long moment quietly passes. 81.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain Whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smokey Robinson and the Miracles' "You Really Got a Hold Me" plays as WHIP eases himself into a recliner using his cane. On the small table next to him rests his beer and a unopened bottle of bourbon with a glass of ice. WHIP crac the seal on the bourbon bottle and pours a drink. He take sip and chases it with his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP now starts to remove the brace that we clearly see u his basketball shorts. As he takes it off he tries to massage his aching leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE enters the living room, fresh from a shower. WHIP studies her -- she's beautiful and innocent.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna lay down, get some rest.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP takes another sip before returning to massaging his  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it really okay that I stay here?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea. I want you to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE walks over to WHIP and kneels down and gently take over massaging his leg. WHIP exhales.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feels better.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's throbbing because the blood is having a hard time getting back to your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 NICOLE continues to soothe his aching leg. After a mom NICOLE stands and takes the drink out of WHIP's hand and it down. She now bends down and kisses him softly. She no stands and takes his hand, leading him in to the bedroom. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's been awake for hours as he sits at the foot of the bed. Whip's wearing a long sleeve tee shirt and sweat pan and no shoes. He looks at NICOLE -- sleeping angelically her side of the bed. Whip watches her sleep for a long moment, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 He hears something. He gets up and goes to the window. 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: car pulling up the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP opens the door to find HUGH in his driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP casts a strange figure with his bare chest, boxers a brandishing a shotgun. They stare at each other.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna shoot me or can I come inside?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon in. I'll shoot you inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH walks closer to the porch. WHIP questions him.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just decided to drop by?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your voice mail is full and you never answer your cell phone. I called your cell 10 times.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH nods as the explanation lands.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd take a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP measures HUGH's intention...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, gimme a minute. Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 HUGH nods and recedes from the door as WHIP goes to ge dressed. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP joins HUGH on a rectangular platform on top of a two story scaffolding frame. The platform provides a perfect view of flight 227's final resting area. We see the aweso devastation that 50 tons of metal flying at 140 miles an can do to a hillside.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see the initial impact sheared the right wing clean off. If only the left wing had come off at impact, I think everyone would have walked off that plane.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The left wing partially pulled away-  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It snapped but stayed connected to the airframe. So it whipped back towards the plane, hit the fuselage in front of the tail. If you were sitting in the last 6 or 7 rows on the left side, it was like being hit by a train.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drank a lot the night before that flight. I drank that morning too and I used coke to straighten up.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's in the toxicology report.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not the reason this happened.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks at HUGH expecting him to finish his thought. H holds his look for a beat before changing thoughts.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The John the Baptist Pentecostal Mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear voices; a low murmur that gets louder, chanting. WHIP looks to the top of the hill to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MINISTER in a dark purple cloak calls from the new testament as the CONGREGATION responds in unison.  MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He will wipe away every tear from their eyes, and death shall be no more, neither shall there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain anymore, for the former things have passed away." -- Revelation 21:4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are at least 50 people sitting in white folding cha at the foot of the hill. A small brook babbles behind the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP continues to take in the bizarre scene.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They helped pull survivors out of the wreckage. Now they come out here every day and have a mass 30 minutes prior to the crash. And then they sit in silent prayer for 10 minutes at 9:42...which is when you went down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is overwhelmed by the magnitude of the crash field a the WORSHIPPERS. WHIP looks back at the crash site to see  NTSB INVESTIGATORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the crash site, a small group of INVESTIGATORS wit NTSB jackets following the lead of a CONFIDENT WOMAN. HUG answers the question in WHIP's mind...    HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen Block, she's the head of the investigation for the NTSB. She's the one that's gonna ask the tough questions.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you bring me here?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed you to see this.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trying to scare me?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know that you can handle all this. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP continues to stare at the awesome dent in the earth.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen clearly. There was a mechanical issue with the plane, but what you and I know? Is that this was an act of God. I'm gonna fight to get the NTSB to place "act of God" on the probable causes list.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's God would do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet before HUGH makes his case.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's the deal. Avington Carr, the owner of the airline, is on our side...and he's got big friends in Washington. He wants to sit down with us. 10 O'clock tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's had enough. He starts to walk away. HUGH stops him  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drink. You're under the microscope. You can't be out buying liquor. No bars, no drugs.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stop. I can stop. (Hugh stays quiet) I told you I can stop. I won't drink.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 O'clock tomorrow morning with Mr. Carr, the owner of the airline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge office with a glass wall that looks out over the diamond. We are high above the outfield; if GOD was a baseball fan, this would be his office. We now meet AVING CARR, a very righteous and self-satisfied, wealthy, south gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: I never wanted that fuckin' airline. Neither did my brother. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARR scans the room, reading faces, holding court.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was my father that wanted it. I like baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ornate, wood furniture helps to announce the political fe of MR. CARR's world. Presidential photos and commendation pepper the walls. It's quiet...  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to HUGH as it gets oddly silent... We get first look at LEN CALDWELL, the president of the pilots' union. LEN tries to wrest some control and exude some confidence.  LEN CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in Georgia likes baseball.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Yeah...so what's the deal Lenny? Is your union gonna survive this one? More importantly? How big a check you think I'm gonna have to write?  LEN CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were 6 fatalities on the PLANE-  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 2 crew members don't get settlements like the passengers. That's a workman's comp claim, part of the union contract -- they do a dangerous job and they know it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: You're the lawyer for the pilots' union?  LEN CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is Hugh Lang, the attorney we brought in to handle the criminal side of Captain Whitaker's situation.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Yes, and what is Mr. Whitaker's situation? NTSB is up my ass with a flashlight. We had to give them access to everything. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) And everyone is curious about Captain Whitaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a glass wall we see...

dialogues.speaker: WHIP SITS ON A COUCH READING A MAGAZINE IN A RECEPTION AR
dialogues.text: CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I flew with him. He's a great pilot.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Is he a drunk?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a heavy drinker. Should I bring him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone steals glances at WHIP as CARR continues to dominate.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: In a minute. Alright, so let's get down to it, Lenny. What does the union plan to do about this blood test that says Whitaker was high on booze and coke? This guy's a real peach.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill the toxicology report. (feels eyes of disbelief) It was done incompetently. The last time the toxicology equipment they used was calibrated was in June of 2009, which is 18 months past code. Their log that should clearly state who labeled the blood vials and when, is very incomplete. And they aren't sure who stored them. They used a preservative in the vials that has in some cases caused blood to ferment and register higher in an alcohol test. That's what I've done so far. I can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: I like this guy Lenny. He makes me wanna go out and sniff a few lines and fly a jet. 88.  LEN CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carr, we're gonna fight to push all the fault on Jackson Ridgefield, the manufacturer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Oh and you think they're gonna just open their check book and buy us all lunch? Good fucking luck. What's my exposure Jim?

dialogues.speaker: CARR'S BUSINESS GUY
dialogues.text: The awards to the families could kill the airline.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Fuck the airline. The insurance companies can have the goddamm airline. I just don't want them to come sniffing in my other pockets.  LEN CALDWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking for the pilots' union? We don't want your airline to go away. We enjoy your contract with us and we will protect Captain Whitaker and in turn protect your airline.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: That's sweet Mr. Caldwell, but if the NTSB leaks that toxicology report showing my pilot was flying that plane drunk? We're all fucked.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far we've been lucky.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Lucky?! Are you that goddammed dumb?! You think they're waiting for a light news day to splash the headline, "Drunk, coke-addled pilot crashes a plane?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE goes quiet as CARR's anger commands silence.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My brother's in DC on his knees at the foot of the throne begging for forgiveness. And so far it's working. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got their boot on the neck of this girl Ellen Block runnin' the show for the NTSB and she is pissed. Can you handle that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH can't stifle a laugh. They look to him.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I'm gonna kill the toxicology report. That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARR looks to his lawyer who nods...  CARR'S ATTORNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you luck, but we're still sorting out the best way to go forward legally. We might split from you and go it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARR stands to signal the end of the meeting. HUGH stands stop him.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go it alone? Without us? That would be what the French call "a big fucking mistake."

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Does Whitaker know he's going to jail?  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a client go to jail yet.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: He's going to jail. He belongs in jail. You bet your ass he's going to jail, the question is...is he gonna die in jail?  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, Mr. Carr.  CARR'S ATTORNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I checked, 6 counts of manslaughter is life in prison.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: Life in prison, what we in Georgia call "all day long."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes quiet as everyone reflects on that reality. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stands up as the meeting spills into the waiting roo Handshakes are exchanged as CARR walks to WHIP and offers hand to shake.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CARR
dialogues.text: They tell me you're some kind of pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 CARR nods, sizing WHIP up. WHIP returns the nod as HUG quickly puts a hand on WHIP's back and leads him away lik heavyweight being returned to his corner after pre-fight instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now in WHIP's living room watching HOME MOVIES...  WHIP'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up! What? You can't get up?! (Whip is laughing...) C'mon, Knuckles Whitaker drags himself up and goes long...go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch an 8 year-old WILL WHITAKER run long as the ball flies to him. He catches it and on-screen WHIP hollers.

dialogues.speaker: WHIP'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Touchdown Whitaker! Atta boy! C'mon back. What? Come back and do it again. Tired? Junior, you don't know tired. I'm not going out. You go out. Keep running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull away from the screen to find WHIP who sits on the couch. A large bottle of vodka appears empty amidst many dead beers and an ashtray that overflows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP moves in drunken slow motion as he attempts to free cigarette from the pack and light it. He freezes at one point and places his hands straight out in front of himse a strange, involuntary, drunken reset. His stare is a 100 miles offshore; he is anywhere but on this planet. Oblivi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light from the HEADLIGHTS of a car in the driveway wa across the walls of the living room. We hear a car door o and women exchange good byes.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Keep coming back, Nicole. One day at a time. 91.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I know, one day at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87A We hear them laugh as WHIP still stares in to space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pushes open and NICOLE comes in with the Big Boo AA in her hand.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry I'm a little late, but we went for coffee after the meeting... (Whip doesn't look) Whip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE goes close to see WHIP look at her with a non-focu stare. She sees the table and reads the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE watches as WHIP stands up. In his oblivion he trie to focus.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, don't, don't! I'll get him. Knuckles, junior. See him. Yeah. I'm not calling again. Fuck him. He didn't call. Not back. Not calling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE backs away as she watches the blacked-out ballet p itself out in slow, tragic fashion. WHIP motions to his l as if he is smoking. He freezes and then steps forward an trips in to the coffee table. Whip falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE checks WHIP's face to see his eyes partially opene but passed out. NICOLE goes to the bedroom and returns wi a blanket that she covers WHIP with. She also places a pillow under his head making sure that his head is titled the side so he doesn't choke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE looks around the room. She begins to collect the bottles and straighten up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON WHIP's FACE as he struggles with a thick hangove He rubs his face and smacks his lips, he's dry as a bone. WHIP shakes his head as he tries to focus his look throug the bedroom window. He looks out to see NICOLE sitting on chair enjoying the landscape. WHIP rubs his head before walking to the kitchen. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls open the door to the fridge and pulls out a ga of water in a plastic jug. WHIP stands and takes a long p of the cold water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE sits with her camera staring at a candle on the ta in front of her. An AA Book rests on the table. She snaps picture of the flame and then focuses out to the grassy landing strip and the rolling hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP enters carrying the large plastic bottle of water fr the kitchen.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP coughs and rubs his eyes.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You were in bad shape when I got home.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired. Guess I drank a bit.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna count the fuckin' beers? They're still in the garbage. Vodka too, is that okay with you?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than okay, Whip.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet as they let the awkward exchange pass.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been watching the sky change as the sun rises. Beautiful. (holds up the camera) Perfect light, I went out and took some great shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP reaches for the camera. She hands it to him. 93.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see that camera.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom got it for me. Towards the end, when she knew she wasn't gonna recover. She maxed out her credit card to buy me that camera and a lighting kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE takes a moment to tamp down some emotions.  NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so beautiful here. Did you grow up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP still holds the camera as he sits down.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my grandfather's farm, my dad grew up here. He was a pilot in World War II, flew with the 332nd. See the landing strip out there? He built that. He ran a crop duster outta here until the EPA put an end to that. (she nods, listening) He traded the crop duster for a used Cessna. He flew that damn thing all over. It's still in the barn. I was gonna sell this place after my dad died. Then I got divorced...  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your mom?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead...she's dead. Your dad still alive?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure my father lives in Colorado.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no relationship with him.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drank. It was my mom that raised me. She was incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE lights a cigarette as the memories are tough. 94.  NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She held it together for so long, I couldn't tell how sick she was. Even through chemo she looked beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE leans over and blows out the candle.  NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave her very heavy meds for pain. Dilauded, morphine, oxycontin. I started taking them with her. We would get all medicated and sit in our back yard and talk and talk and watch the sun go down. We'd be so stoned that we couldn't get up to go inside when it got dark. (laughs, fights the pain) I know it sounds crazy to get hooked on dope with your mom, but she was dying and we spent her last seven months together like teenagers, trading stories about boys and whatever. She loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP lifts the camera and points it at NICOLE. She contor her face into a sly smile. WHIP snaps it...she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue sky is the perfect backdrop as we reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP in a dark suit walks amidst mourners who file out of church. The center of attention is a large, distraught wo in her 60's being consoled by what appears to be her son his wife. The WOMAN wears a pin that holds a photo of TRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stands at the bottom of the steps, watching folks, looking for someone. Suddenly, a 9 year-old BOY stands in front of him. The BOY locks eyes with him.  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Trevor. You saved my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks up to see MARGARET THOMASON walking towards hi She has her left arm in a sling underneath her jacket. We can see a bandage along her hairline. WHIP smiles, obviou uncomfortable. MARGARET hugs him. 95.  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to see you, Whip.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too Margaret. Broken collar bone?  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and some stitches but I'm fine. I really am. (she goes quiet) It was a nice service. I mean, look at all these people that wanted to say goodbye. She looked beautiful in there. (Whip is blank) Didn't you think so, Whip? Like she was gonna wake up and smile.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't go in. I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET is sensing WHIP's struggle.  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor, find Dad. He's by Mr. Benton, there. (TREVOR LEAVES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You should come to the counseling group. The union has great people for us to talk to.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't, really. I will, but just not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet. MARGARET smiles and leans in and kisses WHIP the cheek.  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care Whip, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to leave...WHIP stops her with...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...y'know...I'm in the middle of this investigation. The NTSB is investigating the crash-  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm going in to see them next week. 96.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous because I was out the night before the crash at dinner-  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Trina...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and I had two glasses of wine. And they might ask you about my condition that morning and if you thought I had anything to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET appears speechless...  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known you 11 years and you're gonna stand here and tell me you and Trina went to dinner and you drank two glasses of wine? Sounds like a nice restaurant Whip, which one was it?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell them it was an ordinary day. I mean it was an ordinary day. You know I was in shape to fly. You have a problem with saying that?  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lie. Whip, it's a lie. Trina told me you two hadn't been to sleep.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lack of sleep made the plane fall apart, huh Margaret? I'm just trying to get it straight. You think that another pilot would have been able to land that plane and save more lives?  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that Whip. I can't imagine another pilot doing- 97.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well can you imagine Trevor at this same church looking at you in that box in there? Or my son having to come and see me in prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET fights tears as WHIP has struck a blow.  MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Whip, enough. Don't you think we've all had enough. (Whip is quiet) What do you want me to say?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an ordinary day. The storm right after we took off was very severe, but as far as the flight crew was concerned it was a perfectly ordinary day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tears flow now as MARGARET can't hold them in. WHIP realizes he's gone too far. Not knowing what to do, WHIP walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP watches an airliner fly over head as he stands by hi car smoking a cigarette. He wears his suit from the funer NICOLE approaches. She's in a great mood.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? How was it?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay, okay. How're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got through my first day. They haven't fired me.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Cause for a celebration.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They needed someone to work the night shift. They asked me and it's time and a half so... 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sorts through her shoulder bag...  NICOLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta vest and here's my name tag. Oh oh oh....I got you something.. (hands him a nice lighter) It's a P-51 mustang on there... (flies her arms like WINGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dad flew a P-51, right?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at the lighter) He did. So should we get some dinner?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised Sheila I would be at the meeting tonight. She's the one that's been helping me, my sponsor. Can we do it tomorrow night? And Please, Whip don't make me choose between dinner with you and the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods, playing with the lighter.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. You should go.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come with me? We'll eat after. It's an open meeting.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open meeting?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means anybody can come. Anybody.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is bubbling with happy spirit; she's hot. She's hard deny as WHIP can't help but smile at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN stands at a podium wearing a coat and tie. He is lo in the energized retell of a story. 99.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: The cop is shining his flashlight on me. I'm standing there behind the dumpster, wearing nothing but my girlfriend's panties, vomit on my chest and I say to the cop...about two beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts with laughter. NICOLE is really taken by candor of the speaker as she joins the room in laughter.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: That's why they call me "Two-Beer" Barry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARRY makes eye contact with a STERN LOOKING OLD TIMER. BARRY holds up a loose leaf binder and addresses the man.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: Don't worry Ed, I got the format right here. I'm sorry, Ed's giving me the stink eye. Let me get back to the format... (reads from the format) I'm Barry. I'm an alcoholic.  THE ASSEMBLY (IN UNISON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Barry.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: Are there any other alcoholics present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP glances around to find himself in a sea of raised-ha alcoholics. A few look at WHIP with no judgement.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: I like meetings that have us all identify. Because it makes me tell the truth about who I am. It reminds that I never ever told the truth. I lied about everything. My whole life had been a lie. And I was told that I would never get sober if I kept lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is very reserved, poker-faced.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: I mean, lying's what I'm good at. If I know anything in this life it's how to lie, especially about my drinking. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan the faces and everyone seems immediately connected Except WHIP who leans over to NICOLE.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Okay? (NICOLE NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can uh... (points to Sheila)  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Sheila. She can take me back to work.  SHEILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extends her hand) I'm Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP shakes her hand before quickly escaping as if from a fire. We stay close on WHIP's face as he walks out. BARRY continues his pitch.

dialogues.speaker: A.A. SPEAKER
dialogues.text: Like I said, I would lie about everything. It didn't matter what it was. My whole life had been a lie. A series of lies strung together by me. And when I drank? It was worse. What I came to understand was that, my lies were killing me. And that remains the great fact for me...My lies will kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 WHIP is gone. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP enters the bar and we hear off camera a voice coming from the TV above the bar.

dialogues.speaker: PIERS MORGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The NTSB is focusing their investigation on the flight crew, specifically Captain Whitaker.

dialogues.speaker: KEN EVANS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, I am not at liberty to discuss Captain Whitaker or any of the flight crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks up to the TV. 101.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL BED.
dialogues.text: KEN EVANS (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in truth, I don't have much to say about him.  PIERS MORGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a split screen) So, safe to say that he remains a mystery.  KEN EVANS (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, those are your words not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP exits as fast as he arrived. He's gone. PIERS MORGAN continues from the TV...  PIERS MORGAN (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been speaking to some people who are very close to the NTSB investigation and they are very confident that they will be able to determine exactly what brought this plane down.  KEN EVANS (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they will sir.  PIERS MORGAN (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ken and Vicki Evans.  KEN EVANS (ON TELEVISION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, and God bless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP steps off an elevator and walks down the quiet hospi hallway toward a room where a few TECHNICIANS are packing the last bits of TV equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stands in the doorway and addresses EVANS... 102.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you feeling, Ken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS stares at WHIP with a blank look.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy to be alive.  VICKI EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blessed to be alive.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Whitaker, I was flying-  VICKI EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP senses an unwelcome undercurrent. He locks eyes with EVANS trying to read him. Silence before EVANS speaks to ATTENDING NURSE...  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am can you give us some privacy? Thank you. (TO WHIP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in sir. Shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ATTENDING NURSE files out placing a chair next to the as she leaves. WHIP enters. It's again quiet.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, how long have you been...  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta the coma? Two days.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to disrupt your whole day. I know they been swamping you with interviews. You were great on CNN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS smiles at WHIP.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both my legs were crushed and my pelvis snapped. I'll probably never walk again, least not without a walker or braces. I'll certainly never fly again.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Ken. 103.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That plane was doomed the second you sat in the chair. You reeked like gin or somethin'. I called Vicki from the plane before we took off. That's when the rain kicked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI nods, holding her cross with the chain across her l  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how much you remember, but the plane started to fall apart.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember everything until we crashed. I know what went on.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we talking about?  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Captain Whitaker, what are we talking about?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to get a sense from you what you thought caused the crash.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it the fact that you got on the plane drunk from the night before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP goes white and drops his head.  EVANS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NTSB is coming back tomorrow to finish taking a deposition from me about the events on the flight.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you'd be alive without me on that plane?  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we'd all be dead. But are you gonna argue that your physical state was tip top?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna argue anything with you. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP gets up.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, please sit. (WHIP SITS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never shared my opinion about your physical state the morning of the flight. I've never said word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP sits and studies EVANS.  EVANS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight was pre-ordained. I've prayed on it Captain. Vicki and I have prayed on it. There's only one judge --  VICKI EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise Jesus.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he has a higher plan for you sir. This event although tragic in its loss of life is also a celebration of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVANS begins to mist up with sincere inspiration.  EVANS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens in the Kingdom of the Lord by mistake.  VICKI EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise Jesus.  EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, will you pray with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stares into EVANS' eyes and sees a believer's conviction. EVANS reaches out his hand to WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP slowly moves out of his chair and kneels at the side EVANS' bed. WHIP takes EVANS' hand and bows his head as h reaches for VICKI's at the same time. It's quiet before..  EVANS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus our Lord and savior we thank you for blessing Captain Whitaker with courage and wisdom. For guiding his hand on that fateful morning. In his divine light we were saved. Praise Jesus. 105.  VICKI EVANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is quiet for an extended beat. Finally...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 WHIP looks at EVANS and his WIFE whose heads are bowed reverence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small pickup truck rambles to a stop in the driveway. W hear music and laughter as NICOLE gets out.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride guys. I'll see you tomorrow.  COWORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it up Nicole, you could be employee of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh; Nicole waves as they drive off. She walks towards the house which is dark. She hears music and look towards the barn to see bright light escaping through the sagging doors and split wood walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE slowly approaches the almost glowing barn door. He curiosity compels her to pull it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open to find the plane pointed towards th driveway with an aged patina but revitalized shine. Lenny Kravitz, "Fly Away" blares from the stereo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP emerges from the cockpit. He's still in his suit but with his jacket off and sleeves rolled up. He's energized like an excited kid. He runs up and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE notes the cloud of smoke hanging in the air and th burning cigarette in the ashtray, empty beers.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks great right? 106.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of...beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP wipes at his nose.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Cessna 172, it was my dad's. He kept it perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE takes in this cool trinket of aviation history.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it work...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he flew this plane a few months before he died. I learned to fly in this plane. You can land it anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP laughs, remembering...  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Harling and I flew it to Jamaica.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamaica? In this?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We set off for an overnight fishing trip two hours south of here. We ended up in Bethel, Jamaica.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like a picture on a post card. The white sand and sky blue water. Most beautiful place I've ever been.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the water warm?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really warm.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my kind of place.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. 107.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE laughs thinking they're playing a game.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go tomorrow.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll leave in the morning...we'll just go. Start over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE realizes he's serious as he opens another beer.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip, we can't.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful beach, it's paradise.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs a bit lit) I'm fine thanks.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not, you're really not. You need help, Whip. I think you need rehab.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to a couple of AA meetings and all of a sudden you think you're Jesus Christ? Worry about yourself.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the same Whip, you and me, we're the same-  WHIP WE'RE NOT-  NICOLE WE ARE-
WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't suck dick to get high. And don't give me a whole...  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never Whip, I never in my life-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom died and dad drank and bullshit, bullshit, bullshit --  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Please stop.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you shot dope?  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there's a lot of people out there who lost their mom who've never had a drink in their life.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick, Whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE walks away, leaving WHIP with his plane and his dr of freedom. WHIP calls after her.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I choose to drink.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? You choose it? I don't see a lot of choice goin' on.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I choose to drink! And I blame it on me. I'm happy to. I've got an ex-wife and a son I don't see. Why? Because I choose to drink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow WHIP as he enters the house and approaches the doorway of the bedroom. WHIP sees NICOLE sitting on the b She quickly tucks her cell phone away as WHIP holds up hi hand to signal a truce. 109.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright look, I was loaded when I crashed that plane. With this investigation going on, I don't know what's gonna happen. Come to Jamaica with me.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip. I'm afraid I'll use again.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. I need help, I do.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love for you to get help, Whip.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we get to Jamaica we can go to the local hospital. I'll do it for you. Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE looks at the sincere love in his eyes.  NICOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna use again. I can't. I won't make it back.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be sober. I won't force you to stay. I promise if you don't like it or if I don't clean up? You can leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most sincere plea she's ever heard.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful there. We'll leave before noon. I'm a great pilot. You'll get to see so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP wraps his arms around her. We stay on NICOLE's face he holds her tighter and tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE is dressed and sitting at the kitchen table. Past NICOLE we can see WHIP lying in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has all her possessions in a crate and a duffel bag a her feet. She finishes a handwritten note and places it down. NICOLE picks up the note and begins to reread it. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a car in the driveway -- she picks up her stuff takes one last look at the sleeping WHIP. She leaves, careful not to make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE quietly exits the house, carrying a crate of her stuff. She has a duffel bag of clothes over her shoulder she makes her way to SHEILA's car that we see parked at t top of the driveway, far from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stirs, wakes up and looks around. WHIP walks around looking for NICOLE. He finds the note and reads it. The reality of her disappearance sets in and he moves to the window and stares out at the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP returns his look inside the house and he sees the bi book of AA on the table near where the letter was left. W picks it up and throws it across the room. He then grabs back of a chair and tosses it against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After wiping photos off of the wall he picks up an empty bottle and fires the bottle at a shelf on the opposite wa The bottle explodes and WHIP stops as he realizes he came within an inch of shattering a framed photo of he and his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the antiquated ring of the OLD HOUSE PHONE. WHIP relaxes his shoulders as the ringing phone distracts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip is now drawing heavy breaths as the ringing phone is answered by the old machine...

dialogues.speaker: WHIP'S FATHER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You've reached the Whitaker Crop Dusting Company, flying lessons and plane rides. Please leave a message and it will be returned. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beep concludes...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking to voice mail) Hey Whip, if you're there pickup...I got some good news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP snatches the phone of the hook. 111.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm here. What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 WHIP listens as CHARLIE talks... 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP sits in his car. Rain pounds the windshield as we wa him expertly add vodka to a half-full bottle of orange ju WHIP gives the bottle a shake before taking a long drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP takes another drink before re-capping the bottle and stowing it in the glove box. WHIP gets out and we watch h walk in the rain towards the door of the hangar. A SECURI GUARD meets him and takes him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is now alone in the huge, brightly lit hangar. He se the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JR-88 has all of its pieces laying as close together possible. Like the skeleton of a T-Rex in a museum. The sight is awesome, breathtaking. WHIP walks closer to the twisted wreck and stops. WHIP is overwhelmed by the sight and as he is about to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE steps out of the passenger door and calls down to WHIP.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's our guy. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP walks towards a ramp that leads up to the hole in th plane where the door used to be. CHARLIE stands at the to of the ramp. Suddenly HUGH steps out of the plane...  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Whitaker, we've won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP doesn't move as HUGH starts down the ramp.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what we call in my profession a "walk over."  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've scheduled the hearing. It's in 10 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE and HUGH reach the bottom of the ramp. 112.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But these hearings can be tough. You just need to stay sharp and on course and answer the questions correctly. It's no longer a question of your condition but the condition of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This picks directly at the scab of WHIP's guilt.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had an "Act of God" successfully added to the list of probable causes.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's simple. I flew a broken plane.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. That's right.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about my toxicology report?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to stay calm) I killed it. They have no physical proof that you were intoxicated on that plane. And no eye witness claims. But there's a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops WHIP cold.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the turbulence at the beginning of the flight and then the crash, there was never any drink service on the flight. But, they found two little vodka bottles in the galley trash bin. There was no physical evidence found on the bottles, no DNA, no finger prints. But both the bottles were uncapped and empty. The only people who had access to those bottles and could have drank them were the flight crew. Margaret, Evans and Camelia Satou all had clean tox reports. That leaves you and Trina Marquez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let that land. WHIP nods. 113.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I see...where this is going. That's funny that they found two bottles.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I drank three. One's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH explodes in frustration.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I met you I couldn't believe what a flip, drunk, arrogant scumbag you were.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you too, Hugh.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did the research and heard the analysis from the experts. I'm in awe of what you did.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH gets big as he has to add the final piece of credenc the coronation.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH is so loud and emotional even WHIP lends focus.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know how many were able to safely land these broken planes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone waits for the response as HUGH acknowledges the debris around them...

dialogues.speaker: HUGH LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not one. Every pilot crashed and killed everyone on board. 114.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no capacity to accept the responsibility for the miracle you performed and the lives you saved.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP pulls out his cigarettes and frees a smoke from the pack.   HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go to prison? I'm trying to save your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE steps between them as this exchange spirals.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fucking life?! Don't kill yourself on my account, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP starts to walk away.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm done here. I'm running out a faith that this guy's gonna make it, Charlie.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns on Hugh) You wanna talk about me like I'm not here? Like I'm fucking dead?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Whip now) This NTSB hearing is a Federal Agency Hearing. Do you understand that? It's in 10 days and if I show up with you like this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP turns and walks. HUGH wheels on CHARLIE and lights h up.  HUGH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything we've done? Everything I've done? Goes out the window. That's not on me. I did my job. It's your job, Charlie, to get him straight and get him to the church on time. 115.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Charlie just get him home. Sober him up long enough to save the union's contract and that fat fuck's airline. Fuck you. I shoulda died on that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 WHIP walks away from them -- away from the bright, cl shiny floor of the hangar and into the growing rain storm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has subsided as WHIP pulls up to his driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip turns into the driveway and spots a NEWS VAN in fron his house. He makes a U-turn and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has completely stopped but everything remains we WHIP bangs his front tire in to the curb as he attempts t park in front of a well-maintained house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 WHIP checks the mirrors before taking a long drink fr large orange juice bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP gets out of his car and makes his way across the str and towards the house. We notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER OF A BLACK PRIUS that has been parked farther the street gets out of his car, talking on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP walks up the steps and knocks on the door. He waits beat and knocks again. Finally, it opens -- DEANA, an attractive, well-dressed woman in her 40's, stands there staring.  DEANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lovely to see you too Deana. May I come in? 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEANA takes a moment before stepping aside to allow WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP glides into the kitchen of this fastidiously kept ho  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I`d come see you and Will. (calls out, loudly)

dialogues.speaker: KNUCKLES
dialogues.text: (it's very quiet) We haven't talked at all since this whole thing happened and I just thought we should talk.  DEANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that I prefer that you call us.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
