dialogues.text: Call you? Like anyone in this house has called me in the last three years to say anything other than "Where's the money?"  DEANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been drinking?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that took...what? 17 seconds? (fake checks his watch) It took 17 seconds for you-  DEANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask you to step outside of the house, please.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has continued to rant) LADIES and GENTLEMEN it took

dialogues.speaker: EXACTLY 17 SECONDS FOR DEANA
dialogues.text: COLEMAN to ask me if I have been drinking! A NEW WORLD RECORD!  DEANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling the police.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking me to leave the house I bought for you?! Very good.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm telling you to leave. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP turns to see his 16 year old son, WILL, standing at foot of the stairs near the door.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Whitaker, junior. The man of the house. Nice of you to call me back.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you to leave.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are? Are you the man of the house?  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You upset my mother. You gotta go.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your father, tough guy.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a drunk. Now get the fuck out!  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know who the fuck I am!  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling open the door) I sure don't.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, "I sure don't." Why don't you tell me? Who the fuck are you?! Who are you? Huh? WHO ARE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEANA now steps between them and pushes WILL towards the stairs as she puts her hand on the doorknob.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm outta here. I'm outta here. I know where I'm not wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP turns quietly. He opens the door and walks outside t find... 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is completely caught off guard. They step right onto the tiny landing with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the fracas we hear a variety of questions lobbed WHIP.

dialogues.speaker: DEANA'S PORCH REPORTER
dialogues.text: How come you won't talk to the press?

dialogues.speaker: DEANA'S PORCH REPORTER
dialogues.text: A lot of people are going out of their way to keep you out of the media, are you hiding something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the squelch of a police siren as a COP CAR lands the scene.

dialogues.speaker: DEANA'S PORCH REPORTER
dialogues.text: Do you still live here, Captain Whitaker?

dialogues.speaker: DEANA'S PORCH REPORTER
dialogues.text: How well did you know Katerina Marquez, the flight attendant that died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER trips down the stairs. WHIP grabs one of these news rats and just before pounding him, he breaks in to a relaxed smile.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, please give us some room. (gets down the stairs) At the appropriate time I will tell my story. Now is a time for grieving and taking care of those injured. Thank you. I appreciate your interest in me but I ask that you leave my family in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GALLERY quiets to listen and record his words. WHIP again is incredibly smooth and intuitive while drunk and under pressure. We can hear the squawking of POLICE SIREN approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP starts to head down the porch and the frenzy erupts again. 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE begin to disperse the NEWS RATS. WHIP pulls an officer aside.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Whitaker, I was-  YOUNG COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I know who you are.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me to my car?  YOUNG COP (STUDIES HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you need, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP walks with the YOUNG COP who shields him from the fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the YOUNG COP standing in front of the driver door, shielding WHIP from the press who stay away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 WHIP exhales, trying to slow his racing heart and hea 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drunk but controlled. He looks at his hands. They are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see WHIP on the TV repeating the speech he gave report on DEANA's front lawn...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now is a time for grieving and taking care of those injured. Thank you. I appreciate your interest in me but I ask that you leave my family in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER now wraps up the piece...  TELEVISION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reasonable request from a quiet, heroic man who's been through so much. This is Tilda Banden reporting from Devonwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a DESK ANCHOR changes stories... 120.  DESK ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a related story, tonight at 10 Cale Rawson talks with aviation experts to see if the tragedy of flight 227 could have been avoided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We boom down to find WHIP who looks drained as he sits on CHARLIE's couch in the fastidiously neat office. WHIP hol an unlit smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOODEN POCKET DOORS SLIDE OPEN and CHARLIE's WIFE gestures towards WHIP. WHIP stands as CHARLIE enters.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Charlie. Thank you. Amanda was so nice to let me in. It's just...I couldn't find a safe place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMANDA slides the door shut as CHARLIE throws his bag and coat down with gusto. He reaches up and pushes a button o the TV and it goes off.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you? I spoke to Hugh, he told me that you went to your ex-wife's house? Drunk as a skunk and the news crews showed up? (Whip just stares) And the police escorted you out?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's okay. I've been watching and I think it's okay.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh checked every media outlet that covered it and it looks like we're good. You come off fine.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good then. Listen Charlie, here's the deal-  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Whip. No deals. Look at you. I have no idea what you're gonna do or say, ever. You're all over the place. I was the one guy in your court. I was your apologist, your defender. But not anymore. 121.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can do this.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to be questioned by a Federal Agency about piloting an airliner drunk...an airliner that crashed. And you continue to drink and stumble around. What kind of crazy do you have to be to do that? I'm scared of you.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just stick to the plan.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stick to anything.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing has just been so heavy, it's killing me. Tell Hugh, I can do it. Look, I really wanna fly again, get back to my life and be done with all this shit.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hearing is 10 days away. Hugh busted his ass to try to get you excused, but there's no way. You have to appear.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me stay here. They have my houses all staked out now. Let me stay here until the hearing, Charlie. I won't leave the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE takes a long look at his old, troubled friend.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drink here, Whip. You can't drink in my house. Can you do that?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 CHARLIE nods, hoping that WHIP can deliver on that pr 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch a can of Coca Cola swing in WHIP's hand. We pull out to find WHIP walking with CHARLIE down a hallway of T ST. JEROME HOTEL. Time has passed as WHIP looks the best we've ever seen him look. He is well rested, well dressed and carrying a suit in a wardrobe bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we approach the open door to a guest room, HUGH pops o A plain clothes SECURITY GUARD follows HUGH out of the ro and stands behind him.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great, Whip. I mean that.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I feel really good.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you haven't had a drink in 8 days.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 days... (checks his watch) Two hours and 26 minutes...but who's counting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE addresses the SECURITY GUARD.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Edmonds?  OFFICER EDMONDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip, Officer Edmonds will be staying here tonight. Any problems he'll handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH stands by the open door and gestures CHARLIE and WHI inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH walks in to the center of the room and turns to WHIP  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Whip we just wanted to make this as easy for you as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP puts his wardrobe bag down on the bed. 123.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get a good night's rest. Relax, order up a steak, get a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is checking his phone. HUGH gestures to CHARLIE for to leave so they can be alone.  CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, cowboy, I'm out. The hearing starts at 10, so we should plan on 9 for breakfast here in the room.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Charlie, thanks for letting me stay with you. I needed it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did great cowboy.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a beautiful family.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very blessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE leaves and HUGH joins WHIP at the window. HUGH ha WHIP a thick folder.  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you a copy of my entire file on you and the investigation. I also tried to anticipate what you might be asked under oath and I wrote out some non-damaging responses. It's all in there; photos, testimony, interviews...I called Ellen Block let her know that you're here and all tucked in.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does she have the knife out for me?  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember she's limited in what she can ask you. You're not on trial but you are under oath. She's probably not happy that I killed the tox report, but you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP laughs a little. 124.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH LANG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll see you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two respectfully nod. HUGH leaves and the door shuts behind him. WHIP puts the folder on the table and steps t the mini-bar. He bends down and opens the fridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP sees the fridge is overly stocked with soda and juic Every soft drink you can imagine. No booze, anywhere. WHI chuckles about the alcohol removal as he grabs a coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP unbuttons his shirt and pulls it out of his waist li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip sits on the edge of the bed eating a room service st The File Folder sits on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in his undershirt and shorts, Whip lies propped up on bed watching television. The File Folder now rests on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip is meticulously shaving. He stares a long while at t disposable razor as the water runs over its blade. After moment he goes back to shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip sits at the small table looking through the file. He leafs through photos, with no recognizable emotion. He lo to the clock radio -- 12:37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the shower running and steam fogs the mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP wears boxers and a tee shirt with a towel around his neck. He looks to the clock -- 2:07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP lays the suit out neatly on the couch, separating th shirt which he hangs from a light fixture to relax any creases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. A soft wind RATTLES the window sash. WHIP lies on the bed. He sighs, sleep is alluding him and the anxiety of tomorrow's events on no sleep has his head spinning. He hears a metallic click. He stays quiet to listen for it...there it is again. An annoying click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads "3:43"--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up and switches on the LIGHT. He rubs his eyes an goes to the table and sees the file folder laying there. he is about to pick it up he hears the metallic click aga He goes to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The connecting door is unlocked. WHIP arrives and waits. now watches as the connecting lock-bolt CLICKS against th frame -- the door swinging in a draft. He looks up to see the culprit -- a heating vent. WHIP flips the vent closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip now pushes the door with his finger, opening it a fe inches. Nothing. Darkness.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is vacant. The bed is made. The drapes are pulle open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP walks quietly on the carpet towards the window. The night is clear. Quiet. Whip takes in the city lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the glass and steel office buildings, Whip spots a church spire. A simple cross is perched on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip looks at the church, deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR A HUM. THE GENTLE HUM OF AN ELECTRIC MOTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP turns from the window and scans the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the MINI-BAR refrigerator -- HUMMING to life. 126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip stares at the gleaming black box. The WHIR of the mo seems to get LOUDER. Calling Whip. Beckoning him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip looks at the fridge. His face is blank, His eyes tel nothing. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip steps toward the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE MINI-BAR. Whip swings open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLORS SPARKLE as a cadre of tiny liquor bottles GLOW lik jewels in a chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stares at the "glimmering gems" for a long, long tim vodka, gin, wine, bourbon. The bottles SHIMMER -- AMBER, CRYSTAL, EMERALD, RUBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP reaches for a frosted vodka mini bottle -- he gently pinches the neck of the bottle and lifts it out of the fridge. He holds up the mini vodka and considers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Whip slowly removes the stopper and smells the White Whiskey. He looks at the bottle once more, then slowly tw the tiny cap back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a look of solemn resignation, Whip places the froste mini bottle on top of the fridge and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE STAY CLOSE ON THE BOTTLE. The CAMERA FOCUSES on the sm bottle as a small droplet of condensation runs down its s -- ever so slowly, slowly. Then suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP!!! In a flash, WHIP SCOOPS THE VODKA OUT OF FRAME!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR DOORS open and HUGH and CHARLIE step out and head down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow our guys as they approach WHIP's room, finding OFFICER EDMONDS exactly where we left him -- in front of WHIP's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER EDMONDS stands up as CHARLIE and HUGH approach carrying coffees.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, how's our man? 127.  OFFICER EDMONDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a peep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE knocks on the door and checks his watch as he wai for WHIP to answer. CHARLIE cocks his head, knocks again.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your pilot overslept.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't let any girls in there last night did you?  OFFICER EDMONDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, not a soul. No one came in or out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all wait awkwardly as HUGH checks his watch and knoc on the door. More silence...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER EDMONDS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a room key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE takes the room key and lets himself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE carefully enters WHIP's room. He is spooked by th silence. HUGH joins him as they take in the room. The bed looks slept in and the room service dinner tray rests politely on the dining table but WHIP is nowhere to be fo  HUGH LANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he disappear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE tentatively walks around the empty room, the bathroom, the closet, until he finally sees the adjoining room door. He turns to HUGH with a surprised look.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE knocks on the slightly opened adjoining door. No response, so CHARLIE lightly tosses the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE looks in to find the scene of the crime. Smoke st hangs in the air and empty bottles and cans cover every surface in the room. HUGH joins him... 128.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip? WHIP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE closes his eyes and says a silent prayer as he he for the bathroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is stopped by the sight of WHIP's lifeless body wedged between the tub and the toilet.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE turns WHIP over to see his non-responsive face. H arrives and freaks out.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: I DON'T KNOW
dialogues.text: HUGH

dialogues.speaker: IS HE DEAD
dialogues.text: WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!!! I'm dead!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE shows immediate relief that WHIP is breathing. OFFICER EDMONDS has joined them.  OFFICER EDMONDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I get an ambulance?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!...just wait, Charlie...let's think about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stare at each other and realize they are both breathing heavily from the shock and stress of their predicament.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to the bed... (to the Officer) 129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you wait outside and don't let anyone in here? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDMONDS leaves. CHARLIE and HUGH drag WHIP out of the bathroom and flop him on the bed. HUGH explodes.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! You worthless motherfucker, what a waste! I cleared the decks for you...you piece of shit. You just fucked it all up like the piss drunk you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH grabs at WHIP's collar and WHIP actually sits up and reaches for HUGH, a nice sign of life from WHIP.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOAH!!! WOAH!!! WOAH!!! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE pulls HUGH away from WHIP who falls back on the b  CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9:14, the hearing is in 46 minutes.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much grace do you think we got?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing grace...how sweet the sound...that saved a wretch like me-  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up you drunk...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once was lost and now I'm found was blind but...now...well I'm still kinda blind.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We probably have an hour before we really need to get him to the hearing and it's just downstairs.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a wheel chair.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Harling Mays. 130.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling's got a wheel chair?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling's got cocaine.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocaine? Cocaine?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH and CHARLIE exchange a desperate look...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: WHAT'S HIS NUMBER
dialogues.text: HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fucking insane. And criminal.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 609-237-1184. We're in 609 so just...  CHARLIE (DIALING)
WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 Tell him I need bananas... 129

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE prays for a voice on the other end...it appears..  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harling? Harling this is Charlie. I'm a friend of Whip's...yeah. We need you to do a very early, very discreet...uhm...Whip needs bananas and you need to bring them to The St. Jerome Hotel downtown...how many bunches of bananas? (Whip holds up 3 fingers) 3 is the answer I'm getting -- you will be well compensated...the The St. Jerome Hotel room 1027...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE hangs up and looks at WHIP who is mostly passed o again. CHARLIE looks to HUGH. 131.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and we see HARLING step from the eleva with his knapsack over his shoulder. Teva sandals, sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP has a towel around his neck as he tries to sip coffe CHARLIE sits opposite him at the small table by the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open, and HARLING storms in.  HARLING MAYS (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come mista tally man tally me banana...Whip, what's the deal man you look like you're hurtin' for certain...shut the door, interior lock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING places a leather doctor's bag on the table. An anxious CHARLIE reaches for the bag which sets HARLING in frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet as HARLING gives orders.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone except Whip and myself take three steps away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they step away, HARLING now pulls a beautiful silver- framed mirror from his bag and a blue coke grinder, he ca but sternly delivers orders...

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need three things. (focuses on Charlie) Two glasses of water, a credit card and a hundred dollar bill.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have is a twenty.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the card and bill) That'll do. And I need to make a coco puff. 132.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING Tosses a pack of smokes to CHARLIE.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH takes the smokes from CHARLIE and pulls out a cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING stops grinding, opens the lid and pours out a nic smooth pile of coke. He begins a masterful ballet of coca manipulation.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millions of dollars hang in the balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH is removing the last quarter of an inch of tobacco f the end of the cigarette.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang on the consumption of a 300 dollar bag of cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING uses the credit card to groom the coke into neat piles and lines. He has a system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's head sags as he again appears ready to pass out.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Whip, just two small whiffs first...one on each side...just a primer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the mirror as a tray, HARLING holds the rolled up 2 dollar bill just above the line of coke. WHIP slowly mana to place his face in position to ingest the coke. It's te as his head wobbles. He finally zeroes in and snorts the first line. HARLING quickly switches nostrils. WHIP sniff the other side.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Atta boy, head back now. Swallow. Water, chief, you! Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE puts the glass of water to WHIP's mouth. WHIP drinks.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (snaps his fingers) Coco puff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH hands HARLING the cigarette with a slightly hollowed tip. HARLING leans over the coke with the cigarette in hi mouth and hoovers up a small pile, sucking the coke throu the cigarette. 133.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING sits up, careful to keep the cocaine in the end o the cigarette. He tips it up and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Little coco puff buddy. C'mon banana man. Who's the banana man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP's head levels a look to Harling with a smile that le us to believe that he is actually making a rally.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good man, focus up big dog. Here's the train comin' to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING takes a puff and holds it as he extends the cocai cigarette to WHIP. WHIP is more nimble now as he cocks hi head in acceptance of the cigarette. WHIP takes a drag an holds it.

dialogues.speaker: HARLING MAYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still holding the smoke) Keep it down big dog, banana boat's comin' tell me the banana boat's comin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP finally exhales the smoke, HARLING does too. WHIP smiles.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banana boat is here.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can keep you down dog. Nothing keeps the big dog down.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING has crafted 4 big lines now, he snorts one himsel record time. Looks to HUGH and CHARLIE.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are up.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm good. Charlie?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP jumps in and sniffs 2 huge lines. He looks to HARLIN  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks brother, I'm back. 134.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING gathers his things, stands and hugs WHIP.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you man.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH and CHARLIE are quiet as they watch the strange but sincere drug-fueled emotion pass between two old friends. HARLING eyes CHARLIE before handing him a baggie.  HARLING MAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a gram in here, you paid for it and he might need it. My work here is done. See you all on the dark side of the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLING leaves and our TRIO exchange looks, "Did that jus happen?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133 The opening bars of Joe Cocker's "Feelin' Alright" cr just before we see WHIP step out of the hotel room and be a relatively steady strut down the hallway. Deja Vu. Sunglasses on, WHIP is backed by HUGH and CHARLIE who fla him from a few steps behind. Further back we can see that OFFICER EDWARDS also exits the room wearing latex gloves, carrying a large plastic garbage bag that obviously holds evidence of the debauched night or the morning's resurrection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP, HUGH and CHARLIE ride the elevator. WHIP is buttoni his shirt and fixing his tie. It is miraculous how the co has revived him. A MOM and her 8 year old DAUGHTER get on the elevator.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch as a small trickle of blood escapes from WHIP's nostril. HUGH pulls a handkerchief from his pocket, hands to WHIP.  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your nose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP accepts the handkerchief and wipes his nose. WHIP se blood on the cloth and tilts his head back. 135.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see that there is a mirrored ceiling to the elevat WHIP tries to study his reflection in the ceiling as he h the hankie to his nose. WHIP begins to wobble and CHARLIE helps him regain his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our TRIO walk as tall as they can towards the hearing roo  HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna head in and tell Ellen Block that we're here.

dialogues.text: HUGH hustles off as CHARLIE pulls close to WHIP.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna make it. Remember, if they ask about your drinking, it's totally acceptable to say, "I don't recall."

dialogues.text: WHIP wheels on CHARLIE and unloads with focused anger...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not tell me how to lie about my drinking. I've been lying about my drinking my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we disappear in to WHIP's weary eyes we hear the distinctive sound of a jetliner screaming through the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TWO LARGE SCREENS we watch the grainy cell phone foota shot by a witness of SOUTHJET FLIGHT 227's final moments the sky. ACCOMPANYING the Video is the REAL AUDIO of the cockpit voice recording...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has a dais where the NTSB board members sit. A large blue curtain is the backing for the round NTSB shie that hangs above the proceedings. A large drop down scree will show images, graph and text as needed by the NTSB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confident woman, ELLEN BLOCK, approaches carrying a fil which she lays on the podium.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are difficult images to watch. For the record, I'm Ellen Block, Hearing Officer for this hearing. Captain Whitaker, good morning. 136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see WHIP who looks rough but stable in his witness cha  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was captured on that video is that the aircraft was in a relatively stable glide just prior to the moment of impact. However, according to the data we retrieved from the cockpit data recorders, at exactly 9:34, after flying 27 minutes without incident, the transponder recorded a loss in altitude in excess of 4800 feet per minute in what is considered a "full pitch nose down" attitude. Then at 9:42, according to the data recorders, a decision was made to invert the aircraft. The NTSB has created animated simulation that I would like to play at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLEN points to the screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NTSB animation shows the plane pitching down and we fo it through the inversion of the plane while listening to real audio of the flight crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animation has a split screen that also shows the instruments and printed text of what's being said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear..."What's your son's name?" "Why?" "The black box "I love you, Trevor. Be a good boy, Mommy loves you." "Wh are we doing?! Why would I trim down?!" "We're gonna roll it. Ready? Here we go. I've got control."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That last statement seems to echo as the presentation sto and the lights come back up. We return to the hearing in progress.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That audio is tragic and compelling. I chose to play that part of the cockpit recording to highlight a key moment aboard flight 227, wherein you say "We're gonna roll it, here we go, I've got control." You made a very conscious decision to invert the airplane, to roll the plane upside down. Is that correct? 137.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure it was conscious. It was more of an instinct.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What led to that decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is clearly struggling in his chair. The coke got him there but it may start to fail him soon.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recall.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me quote from an investigative summary..."From 9:34 until 9:42 the events on the aircraft are"...again I quote, "bold and remarkable"... "By inverting the plane, Captain Whitaker arrested the descent and allowed the aircraft to level off enabling him to glide the aircraft away from any populated areas and allowing him to execute a forced landing in an open field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a smattering of applause as the facts of his acti are remarkable.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard a metallic bang. We pitched nose down. No control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks ashen as the booze and chemicals are still coursing through his exhausted frame.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no idea what was wrong with the aircraft?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a lot of things wrong with that aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP glances towards HUGH and CHARLIE who are poker-faced  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said before you can add any details you like to any comments I make. Do you remember any thing else that was out of the ordinary? Did you feel the flight crew was in their best shape? 138.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP takes a minute to digest this question.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was raining very hard the morning you took off, wasn't it?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was some convective activity in the area. However, my first officer and I discussed the conditions on the field and determined that we were safely within our visibility and crosswind minimums.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, first officer Evans' testimony confirms the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP goes quiet as ELLEN BLOCK looks at him over her glas seeing if he has any reaction. WHIP smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH is frozen in a steely gaze; CHARLIE seems to hold hi breath.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLEN points her remote at the projector but it doesn't w

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This remote is not working. Apologies. I can do it manually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs and heads down onto the stage closer to WHIP w she can advance the slides by touching the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see a screen where a slide is showing a long metal screw the size of a trombone.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the jackscrew on the tail assembly which articulates the horizontal stabilizer--also known as the elevator. As you can see, the threads on this screw are almost entirely gone. " 139.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Substandard thread life" is how we reported it. This part was suggested as a maintenance replacement in January of 2010. It was never replaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This had 1200 additional hours of flight on it. It finally failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the elevator acting as a wing on the tail that g up or down and makes a plane get lift or descend.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our investigators have concluded that the jackscrew snapped and the elevator was frozen in a fixed position, locking the elevator in a down position which forced the plane into a dive. The loss of the elevator was, and I quote our report, a "catastrophic event, from which recovery was improbable and stable flight impossible."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone goes quiet as those words resonate. ELLEN's tone changes as she understands how hard this is for some peop to hear as they think of their loved ones spending their living minutes on this earth in sheer terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deathly quiet in the ballroom. Even the PRESS are silent.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again I quote..."From 9:34 until 9:42 the piloting decisions made by Captain Whitaker were bold and remarkable. The fact that Captain Whitaker commanded that the aircraft stay inverted while descending to an extremely low altitude shows a miraculous intuition that in this instance saved 96 lives."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A genuine applause spreads from the hearing room. ELLEN BLOCK allows this moment to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP is fading, dazed and uncomfortable with the unexpect adulation. He stands up.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. 140.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room gets quiet as WHIP's demeanor seems terse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stares at ELLEN, white with sweat and chemicals. We HUGH grind his jaw as this line of questioning has him on tilt.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Whitaker, I want to talk about the days leading and hours leading up to the accident. But before I do, I want to remind you that you are under oath and any testimony that you give here today will be considered admissable in any subsequent hearings or criminal proceedings, do you understand what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Captain Whitaker, for the record I need you to verbalize your answer.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the three days leading up to the day of the accident -- Tuesday, October 11th, Wednesday, October 12th or Thursday, October 13th of 2011 -- did you consume any alcohol or other intoxicating elements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP takes his time.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit stone faced in the second row feeling the relief of months of hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLEN BLOCK continues with a rote posture...  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the morning of the accident, Friday, October 14th, did you consume any alcohol or ingest any chemicals or drugs that may have impaired your ability to perform your job? 141.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLEN wraps up this line of questions...  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Whitaker, do you now or have you ever had a problem with alcohol dependency, alcoholism or drug addiction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP waits for her to look at him...this takes a while...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGH maintains a poker face; CHARLIE appears relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLEN sorts through her notes one last time.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mr. Whitaker, we're about done. (She refers to her notes) Due to the severe turbulence during the early part of the flight, you asked the flight crew to suspend the beverage service on the plane. Is that correct?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I suspended the drink service.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you aware that our investigators found two single- service Vodka bottles in the galley trash bin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slides now show the TWO SMALL VODKA BOTTLES in evidence.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were 5 crew members on board the flight who would have had access to the beverage trolley. Less than an hour after the accident, blood was taken from each of the crew members. Yourself... 142.

dialogues.text: A SOUTHJET CORPORATE PHOTO OF WHIP pops on to the large monitors. After ELLEN references a member of the flight crew, their photo pops on to the monitors...

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First Officer Evans, flight attendant Margaret Thomason and posthumously from Camelia Satou and Katerina Marquez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATERINA MARQUEZ PHOTO does not pop up on the screen...ye

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A toxicology analysis was performed and three of these tests came back negative, one was disqualified for technical reasons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh smiles -- satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And one tested positive for alcohol. It registered a .17 blood alcohol level. Are you aware of that?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am now.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.text: Miss Marquez was not only a colleague, but you knew her outside of work? Correct?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of work? Not really.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.text: Did you know Miss Marquez had a drinking problem?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.text: Did you ever see her drink to excess?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not. 143.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.text: Did you know that she was twice treated for alcohol addiction? The last time was 16 months ago and paid for by SouthJet Airlines?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picture of Trina's beautiful smiling face FLASHES UP ON BIG SCREEN.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your opinion that Katerina Marquez drank the vodka on the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP smiles at the photo of TRINA as if she can see him. then shakes his head to snap from the memory of her great spirit. He gets serious as he bears his look down on ELLE  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you repeat the question?  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your opinion Captain. Is it your opinion that Katerina Marquez drank on that flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip shakes. He runs his trembling hand through his hair.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. My what...  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since her toxicology report is the only toxicology report that is admissable in this hearing, and she in fact tested positive for alcohol, is it your opinion that Katerina Marquez drank those 2 bottles of vodka on the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip drops his head and MUTTERS SOMETHING INAUDIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN BLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mr. Whitaker, I couldn't hear you. What did you say?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I SAID...God help me... 144.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused MUMBLE rises in the room. Whip's response flusters ELLEN for a moment, but she recovers quickly.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well. However, is it your opinion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip cuts her off...  WHIP (EXCESSIVELY LOUD)

dialogues.speaker: IT'S MY OPINION...
dialogues.text: (lowers his voice) It's my opinion... Trina DID NOT...drink the vodka.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Whitaker...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, to himself) She saved that boy's life...  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Whitaker can you speak LOUDER-  WHIP (LOUD AGAIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip stops. His whole body trembles, his face tightens. H looks right at ELLEN...  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because I did. I drank the vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd gasps, unsure of what they just heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE rockets out of his chair.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: OBJECTION
dialogues.text: NTSB OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be seated sir. This is not a court room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now CHARLIE returns to his chair to find that HUGH is gon CHARLIE looks around for HUGH, no sign. He's vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP leans close to the microphone. 145.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drank the vodka bottles on the plane.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Whitaker, in light of that remark, would you like to readdress...  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to readdress anything. I DRANK THE VODKA!  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the three nights before the accident, October 11th-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On October 11th, 12th and 13th and 14th I was intoxicated. I drank alcohol on all of those days. I drank to excess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos erupts further as REPORTERS outnumber SECURITY. Fla bulbs pop repeatedly and large lights are aimed at the fr on stage as video is taken of the bizarre melee.  ELLEN BLOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Whitaker, on the morning of OCTOBER-  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was drunk. I'm drunk right now, Miss Block...I'm drunk right... (Whip finally breaks down) I'm drunk now, because... Because I'm an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have pushed into a tight shot on WHIP's face as the so in the room fades away. We stay tight on WHIP's face as h lets the moments unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the noise cuts to silence. WHIP is looking at th assembly. WHIP wipes tears from his eyes. We hear WHIP's voice as the dialogue pre-laps the image of his face.

dialogues.speaker: WHIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was it...I was done. It's as if I'd hit my life long limit for lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new angle shows WHIP speaking these words... 146.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could not tell one more lie. And maybe I'm a sucker. Because if I had just told one more lie? I could have walked away from that whole mess and kept my wings and my false sense of pride and most importantly I would have avoided being locked up here with all of you nice folks for the last 13 months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear laughter as we pull out from WHIP to realize that is in fact wearing a white penal jumpsuit and leading an meeting in a Federal Prison.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like I will serve every day of the remaining 4 plus years of my sentence. And that's fair. I betrayed the public trust. I did. That's what the judge explained to me. I had betrayed the public trust. The FAA took my license. And that's fair. The chances of me flying again are slim to none. And I accept that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room houses an AA meeting for about 50 inmates wearing white jumpsuits. WHIP continues his story.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had time to think about all of it. Doing a lot of writing. I've written letters to each of the families that lost loved ones on my flight. Some were able to hear my apology, some never will. I've also apologized to all the people who tried to help me along the way, but I couldn't or wouldn't listen, like my wife, I mean my ex wife... (he gets emotional) ...and my son. Again, some were able to forgive me...some never will. (COLLECTS HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at least I'm sober, and I'm grateful for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whip gives it to us straight... 147.  WHIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is gonna sound really stupid coming from a man who's in prison...but for the first time in my life...I'm free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold close on WHIP's face as we hear the metallic clan prison doors shutting. On the sound we cut to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan across the concrete cell wall, looking at a small, personal photo collage. We see a photo of NICOLE and SHEI and a few other AA FOLKS surrounding WHIP who sits in fro of a birthday cake in the common room of the prison. We s a photo of WHIP's DAD as an airman. We ultimately land on photo of NICOLE. We recognize it as the photo WHIP took o the porch of the Whitaker Farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan down to find WHIP writing in a journal. A GUARD co to the front of his cell.  GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitaker, you got a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP looks at the GUARD and nods before taking a last gla at the photo of NICOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP sits at a lone picnic table in a fence-enclosed courtyard. He checks his watch and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP stands and walks towards us, towards his visitor. As gets closer we see a smile break across his face. A smile haven't seen since he first saw NICOLE. We reverse to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL -- WHIP's 17 year old son stands next to a GUARD.  GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have 40 minutes.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knuckles, you're looking good. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you something for your birthday.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another beat as they can't find a way in to a conversatio 148.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a real surprise; a great surprise. I haven't seen you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP chokes up. WILL nods. It's intense. WHIP motions to the table and they both sit. WILL pulls out a notebook.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College counselor thought I should come and interview you.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. An interview. Okay.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm writing essays for college applications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP studies him and laughs...WILL nods and tries to smil  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Will, it means everything to me that you came here. You are an amazing kid and you deserve great things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again WHIP has to tamp down his emotions.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can you help me with this essay?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL pulls out a small voice recorder and clicks it on...    WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This essay. I have to do an essay called, "the most fascinating person I've never met."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men just look at each other.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL nods, both men are struggling to keep it together.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we pick up where we left off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP nods, unsure as to where this is going. 149.  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  WILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?  WHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP smiles...a great, familiar question. He begins to alternately laugh and sob as there is great relief in the promise of a connection with his son.
